info.title: Tanium Core Platform REST API Reference

license.name: APIs are governed by the customer license agreement. See the End User License Agreement.

get.description: Retrieve all actions (action objects) on the server.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request.

Available options include:
  • cache_expiration: Include to preserve the cache results for a number of seconds.
  • cache_filters: Include to limit the results returned.
  • cache_id: Include to reuse results from a previous request.
  • cache_sort_fields: Include a comma-separated list of fields to sort the cached results in ascending order. Prepend "-" to a field to sort in descending order. Use dot notation to sort on supported subfields. You can sort on the following:
    • action_group (subfield sort supported)
    • approver (subfield sort supported)
    • approver_persona (subfield sort supported)
    • creation_time
    • comment
    • distribute_seconds
    • expiration_time
    • expire_seconds
    • id
    • name
    • package_spec (subfield sort supported)
    • persona (subfield sort supported)
    • saved_action (subfield sort supported)
    • start_time
    • status
    • target_group
    • user (subfield sort supported)
  • include_hidden_flag: Set to 1 to include deleted personas in the response.
  • include_persona_owned_object_ids_flag: Set to 1 to also retrieve the id and name values for each plugin_schedule, saved_action, and saved_question object owned by each persona.
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all action objects on the server in addition to the cache_info object. If there are no action objects, the response only contains the cache_info object.

post.description:
Create an action (action object). An action specifies a package to deploy, the machines to target, and the deploy schedule.

For general information about actions, see Tanium Core Platform User Guide: Actions overview.

requestBody.description: The action to create. The package_spec, action_group, and target_group are required properties. For a parameterized package (package_spec object), reference the package by defining the package_spec.source_id property with the package_spec.id value or defining the package_spec.source_name property with the package_spec.name value, and pass a value for every parameter.

200.description: The new action.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • ActionRequiresPackage The input JSON must contain the package_spec object.
  • PackageNameRequired The package_spec object in the input JSON must contain the id property or the name property.
  • AddActionFailed Make sure the input JSON contains all required properties.

get.description: Retrieve actions (action objects) that match the specified name. Action names do not need to be unique, therefore this path might return multiple actions.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the actions to retrieve.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of actions that matches the name.

200.description: A data object that contains the action that matches the ID.

parameters.description: The ID of the action to update.

4XX.description: No action matches the specified ID.

get.description: Retrieve all action groups (action_group objects) on the server.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all action groups on the server. If there are no action groups, returns an empty array.

requestBody.description: The action group to create. No properties are required.

200.description: A data object that contains the new action group.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • ActionGroupNotFound The input JSON must not contain the id property.
  • GroupNameNotUnique Another action group with the same name already exists. Select a different name or delete the existing action group with the same name.
  • ActionGroupNameInvalid The input JSON must contain the name property.

patch.description: Update the action group (action_group object) that matches the specified ID. When you update an action group, the server creates a new action_group object using the properties from the original action group and the properties supplied in the input JSON. The server then sets the deleted_flag property on the original action_group object to <samp>1</samp>.

requestBody.description: An action group that contains the properties to update. Properties not included are not updated. Any properties that you specify overwrite existing properties.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the action group to update.

200.description: A data object that contains the updated action group.

Possible responses include:

  • ActionGroupNameInvalid The name property must contain a value.

get.description: Retrieve a count of all active user accounts over the past 30 days.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • active_user_age_limit_days: Set to an integer between 1 and 45078 to retrieve a count of active user accounts during the prior number of days. If undefined, this defaults to 30.
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

active_user_age_limit_days.summary: Retrieve active users over past year

200.description: A data object that contains the number of active users.

delete.description: Delete the API token (api_token object) that matches the specified ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the API token to delete.

200.description: A data object that contains the deleted API token. The deleted_flag property is set to <samp>1</samp>.

data.notes: My module token that expires in 30 days.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • APITokenNotFound No API token matches the specified ID. The API token might already have expired.
  • Unauthorized If authenticating with tokens, verify the token string is valid and that the IP of the client is listed in the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting.

get.description: Retrieve the API token (api_token object) that matches the specified ID. The object returned by this path does not include the token_string property.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the API token to retrieve.

200.description: A data object that contains the API token that matches the ID.

data.notes: My module token that expires in 30 days.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • Unauthorized If authenticating with tokens, verify the token string is valid and that the IP of the client is listed in the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting.
  • APITokenNotFound No API token matches the specified ID. The object does not exist or it expired.

get.description: Retrieve all active API tokens (api_token objects) on the server. The objects returned by this path do not include the token_string properties.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all API tokens on the server.

data.notes: My module token that expires in 30 days.

4XX.description: Unauthorized Verify the token string is valid and that the IP of the client is listed in the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting.

patch.description:
Rotate the token for the API token (api_token object) that matches a specified token string and ID. This path deletes the API token and creates a new API token that you can use for authentication.

Note: The new API token maintains applicable properties of the original API token, including user, expire_in_days, and notes.

requestBody.description: The token string.

200.description: A data object that contains the new API token.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • InvalidJSONBody The format of the input JSON is not valid. Make sure the input JSON contains the token_string property and value.
  • Unauthorized Make sure that you have privilege to rotate the token, and that the token is valid.

post.description:
Create an API token (api_token object) for a user and persona that you can use for authentication across multiple sessions.

IMPORTANT: By default, the Tanium Server blocks API tokens from all addresses except registered Tanium Module Servers. To add additional allowed IP addresses for any API token, add the external IP addresses of the endpoints to the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting. To add allowed IP addresses for an individual API token, specify the IP addresses in the api_token.trusted_ip_addresse property.
  • For proxies, set the authenticate_api_token_with_x_forwarded_for_ip global setting to 1 to force the Tanium Server to check for the IP provided by the X-Forwarded-For header (if one exists) for compatibility with reverse proxies situated between the client and the Tanium Server.
  • As with all API requests, you must have a valid session string or an existing token string to create a token. You cannot use an existing token string to generate a valid session string.
  • To use tokens, users must be assigned the Administrator reserved role or have the Token - Use permission, and must be signed in as the persona associated with the token. When you create an API token, you can define as_persona property in the body with a persona ID to associate the API token with a persona. If you do not define this when creating the API token, the persona ID of the active session populates this property.
  • By default, an API token is valid for seven days. To change the expiration timeframe, edit the api_token_expiration_in_days global setting (minimum value is 1), or include a value with the expire_in_days property when you create the token.
  • To use API tokens on a Tanium Appliance with the Tanium All-in-One role, you must change the IP address of the Tanium Module Server from 127.0.0.1 to the actual IP address of the machine. To do so, change the ModuleServer local setting in Tanium Console. For more information, see Tanium Console User Guide: Managing Tanium Server Platform settings.
  • If the server restarts, the tokens remain valid.
  • To use API tokens in a Tanium Cloud environment to query the API Gateway, use the following address: https://<customerName>-api.cloud.tanium.com/plugin/products/gateway/graphql. For more information, see Tanium API Gateway User Guide: Authentication.


Tips:
  • To allow any token to be used from any IP address in a lab environment, set the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting to 0.0.0.0/0. For optimal security, do not use this value in production environments.
  • To allow a specific token to be used from any IP address in a lab environment, set the trusted_ip_addresses property to 0.0.0.0/0. For optimal security, do not use this value in production environments.
  • Failed authentication attempts are signed in the <Tanium Server>/Logs/auth0.txt file.

requestBody.description: Include either an empty data set or properties from the api_token object to set. If you include properties from the api_token object, you can also add the as_persona property (see description above). You can pass an empty data set on the header as <samp>--data "{ }"</samp> or <samp>--data null</samp>.

example.name: my token
example.notes: My module token that expires in 30 days.

200.description: A data object that contains the new API token. Use the token_string value (including the <samp>token-</samp> prefix) instead of a session string as authentication for additional API paths.

one.summary: Example (from request with empty data set)

data.name: my token
data.notes: My module token that expires in 30 days.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • Verify the syntax of the request and that the server is running and reachable from the client.
  • Unauthorized If authenticating with tokens, verify the token string is valid and that the IP of the client is listed in the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting.
  • InvalidPersonaForUser If you defined as_persona, the persona ID does not exist. Verify the persona ID.

get.description:
Retrieve the audit log entries (audit_log objects) for a specified object. The id path parameter is optional.
  • When the id parameter is included, the path returns the most recent audit entry for the specified ID (object_id).
  • When the id parameter is not included, the path returns the most recent entry for each unique object_id.
  • Use the audit_history_size option to control the number of entries returned (see the Header parameters table for details).
  • You can also include optional start_time and end_time options to limit the audit entries. Note the start_time and end_time parameters are ignored when a cache_id is used.
  • Tip: Include options as only header parameters or only query string parameters in a single request. If you include options as both header parameters and query string parameters, the server might ignore the query string parameters.


Note: Audit data is deleted according to the max_audit_data_expire_days global setting.

Note: The max_soap_audit_entries_per_cache global setting limits the number of audit entries to put into the server cache. The default value is 1,000,000.

2 The authentication audit does not have a corresponding object. The path returns entries for failed and successful sign-on attempts.
3 Includes audit logs for filter_group and management_rights_group objects.

Tip: Use the GET /api/v2/audit_types path to get an updated list of objects that you can audit on the server.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • audit_history_size:
    • When you specify an ID in the path, specify audit_history_size to control the number of audit entries to return for the specified object ID. Default value is 1.
    • When no ID is specified in the path, set audit_history_size to any number except 1 to return all audit entries for the audit type. Set to 1 (or omit) to return one entry for each unique object_id.
  • cache_expiration: Include to preserve the cache results for a number of seconds.
  • cache_filters: Include to limit the results returned.
  • cache_id: Include to reuse results from a previous request.
  • cache_sort_fields: Include a comma-separated list of fields to sort the cached results in ascending order. Prepend "-" to a field to sort in descending order. Use dot notation to sort on supported subfields. You can sort on the following:
    • audit_row_id
    • creation_time
    • details
    • last_modified_by
    • modification_time
    • modified_persona (subfield sort supported)
    • modified_user (subfield sort supported)
    • object_id
    • object_name
    • type
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.
  • min_audit_row_id: Only include audit entries with a specified minimum audit_row_id property.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of object for which to retrieve the audit log.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the object for which to retrieve the audit log. When the data is returned, the ID is contained in the object_id property.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: A start date and time to filter the data. Use the format <samp>YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ</samp>. This parameter is ignored when a cache_id is specified.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: An end date and time to filter the data. Use the format <samp>YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ</samp>. This parameter is ignored when a cache_id is specified.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of matching audit logs and a cache_info object.

Possible responses include:

  • InvalidAuditType The specified type does not exist. Verify the syntax of the type and make sure the name is plural. For example, use "packages" instead of "package".

post.summary: Create computer group using cached row reference IDs
post.description:
Create a computer group (computer_group object) using cache IDs and row reference IDs from results data.

For example, when you GET /api/v2/result_data/question/{id} or GET /api/v2/result_data/saved_question/{id}, and pass a tanium-options header including a cache_expiration value, the results contain a cache_id value, and each row has a ref_id reference value. You can pass the cache_id and one or more ref_id reference values to create a computer group including only the endpoints corresponding to the referenced rows.

requestBody.description:
A JSON object that contains:
  • The cache ID of the results data row to include for computer group targeting.
  • An array of ref_id reference values of results data rows to include for computer group targeting. You must define at least one reference_ids value for the request.

200.description: A data object that contains the ID of the new computer group.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • MustSpecifyNonEmptyReferenceIDs You must include at least one reference_ids value for the request.
  • MustSpecifyCacheIDAndReferenceIDs You must include at least one cache_id value and at least one reference_ids value for the request.

get.description: Retrieve a count of the clients in the network.

200.description: A data object that contains the number of clients in the network.

post.description:
Create a manual computer group (computer_group object). For more information about groups, see Tanium Console User Guide: Managing computer groups.

To create a manual group that is also a management rights group, see the POST /api/v2/management_rights_groups path.

requestBody.description: The manual computer group to create. The name property is required. Use the computer_specs property to specify the computers to include in the group.

200.description: A data object that contains the new manual computer group.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • ComputerGroupNameRequired The input JSON must contain the name property.
  • ComputerGroupAlreadyExists Select a different computer group name, or delete the existing group with the same name. If you delete the existing group, make sure the group is not in use.

  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. Can also be included as a query string parameter.

post.description: Create a content set (content_set object). A content set is a group of sensors, saved questions, dashboards, categories, and packages to which a permission applies. A content set is required for every sensor, package, saved question, dashboard, and dashboard group.

get.description: Retrieve all dashboards (dashboard objects) on the server.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • cache_expiration: Include to preserve the cache results for a number of seconds.
  • cache_filters: Include to limit the results returned.
  • cache_id: Include to reuse results from a previous request.
  • cache_sort_fields: Include a comma-separated list of fields to sort the cached results in ascending order. Prepend "-" to a field to sort in descending order. Use dot notation to sort on supported subfields. You can sort on the following:
    • content_set (subfield sort supported)
    • deleted_flag
    • group_id
    • id
    • name
    • public_flag
    • user (subfield sort supported)
    • text
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

parameters.name: tanium-options

test auth cert 3

post.summary: Create Downloads Authentication remote source authentication certificate and paired private key
post.description:
Create a Downloads Authentication remote source authentication certificate and paired private key. The client certificate and paired key are used for authentication to a remote server.

Your certificate must be in PEM format. You must include the entire content of the certificate, including -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- and -----END CERTIFICATE-----. Your private key must be in PEM format. You must include the entire content of the private key, including -----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY----- and -----END PRIVATE KEY-----.

requestBody.description: The downloader_auth_cert object to create.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

200.description: A data object that contains the ID of the new downloader_auth_cert object.

4XX.description: InvalidJSONBody The format of the input JSON is not valid.

5XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • MustSpecifyCertificate The request does not include a certificate.
  • MustSpecifyPrivateKey The request does not include a private key.
  • NoCertificateFound The request contained an invalid or non-OpenSSL server certificate.
  • OpenSSLError There is an error validating the certificate and paired private key. Verify that you entered the correct contents of both in the request.
  • UnexpectedListName The request contained an improper JSON element.

get.description:
Export object history by the name of the history type. Administrators and users with the Export Content permission are able to export content. Objects export to a JSON or CSV format that you can save to a file. Valid objects to export include:
  • action_history
  • question_history

In the URI, pass the optional input query parameter as URL encoded JSON if you also define mode=csv as a query parameter.
  • The input.columns parameter is optional, to select specific columns and display names to output in the response. If this is not defined, the default columns and English display names are included in the response.
  • The input.ids parameter is optional, to include certain objects in the response that match the ID. If this is not defined, all objects are included in the response.

For example, to pass the following:
{ "columns": [ { "key": "id", "name": "question_id" }, { "key": "user/name", "name": "User Name" } ], "ids": [ 123, 234, 345 ] }

Define the query string as:
?mode=csv&input=%7B%20%22columns%22%3A%20%5B%20%7B%20%22key
%22%3A%20%22id%22%2C %20%22name%22%3A%20%22question_id%22%20
%7D%2C%20%7B%20%22key%22%3A%20%22user%2F name%22%2C%20%22name
%22%3A%20%22User%20Name%22%20%7D%20%5D%2C%20%22ids%22%3A%20 %5B
%20123%2C%20234%2C%20345%20%5D%20%7D.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • cache_expiration: Include to preserve the cache results for a number of seconds.
  • cache_filters: Include to limit the results returned.
  • cache_id: Include to reuse results from a previous request.
  • cache_sort_fields: Include a comma-separated list of fields to sort the cached results in ascending order. Prepend "-" to a field to sort in descending order. Use dot notation to sort on supported subfields. You can sort on the following for action history:
    • action_group (subfield sort supported)
    • approver (subfield sort supported)
    • approver_persona (subfield sort supported)
    • creation_time
    • comment
    • distribute_seconds
    • expiration_time
    • expire_seconds
    • id
    • name
    • package_spec (subfield sort supported)
    • persona (subfield sort supported)
    • saved_action (subfield sort supported)
    • start_time
    • status
    • target_group
    • user (subfield sort supported)
    You can sort on the following for question history:
    • action_tracking_flag
    • context_group
    • expiration
    • expire_seconds
    • hidden_flag
    • id
    • management_rights_group
    • name
    • persona (subfield sort supported)
    • query_text
    • saved_question (subfield sort supported)
    • skip_lock_flag
    • user (subfield sort supported)
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: (Optional, allowed only if mode is <samp>csv</samp>) The URL encoded JSON specifying the column mappings and object IDs.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description:
(Optional, allowed only if the mode property is csv) An array of objects containing a key property value corresponding to a property on the action or question object, and show the value of the name property.

If you want to export an action or question object nested field, define the key property value as a property path, separated with slashes (/). For example, if you want to export a package name, define the key property as package_spec/name. If you do not define this, the default columns in English are included in the response.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: (Optional, allowed only if the mode property is <samp>csv</samp>) An array of object IDs to include in the response. If you define this, object IDs not matching this array are not included in the response.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Set to <samp>csv</samp> for CSV export file format, or <samp>json</samp> for JSON export file format.

200.description: An object_list object that contains the exported objects in a JSON or CSV format.

post.description:
Export objects by the name of the objects. Administrators and users with the Export Content permission are able to export content. Any related objects are included in the export. Objects export to a JSON format that you can save to a file. Valid objects to export include:
  • content_set
  • content_set_privilege
  • content_set_role
  • content_set_role_privilege
  • dashboard
  • dashboard_group
  • group
  • ldap_sync_connector
  • package_spec
  • saved_action
  • saved_question
  • sensor
  • white_listed_url


Notes:
  • Use the group object to export filter_group and management_rights_group objects.
  • If you export a saved_question object, the keep_seconds value is defined as the value associated with your user account and active persona, regardless of the value on the saved question before export.
  • You can export saved_action objects by ID or name. See example for the syntax to export by ID.

requestBody.description: JSON specifying the object type and object names to export. Use the format <samp>{ "objects" : { "include" : [ "name1", "name2" ] } }</samp>. To export saved_action objects by ID, use the format <samp>{ "saved_actions" : { "include_by_id" : [ ID1, ID2 ] } }</samp>. Alternatively, you can include all objects of a type using a "include_all" property set to <samp>true</samp>.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • export_by_content_set_ids: Include an array of one or more content set IDs to only export objects assigned to those content set IDs. Must be used with the include_all property set to true.
  • export_dont_include_related: Set to 1 if you want the export to not include related objects.
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

200.description: A data object that contains the exported objects in a JSON format.

post.description:
Create a filter group (filter_group object).

For best results, use POST /api/v2/management_rights_groups to create management rights groups, POST /api/v2/filter_groups to create filter groups, or POST /api/v2/groups to create other group types.

requestBody.description:
The filter group to create. The name property is normally required. If you have one of the following privileges, you can exclude the name property to create an anonymous group:

  • Content Administrator reserved role

  • Ask Dynamic Questions permission (Tanium Interact)
  • Action write permission
If you reference a parameterized sensor in the filter group, pass a comma-separated list of values in brackets ([]) after the sensor name in the text property.

get.summary: Get Tanium Server SSL certificate signing request
get.description: Retrieve a generated Tanium Server SSL certificate signing request (https_certificate_signing_request object). Copy the value of the pem property in the response and save it in a .csr file. Submit the CSR to a certificate authority (CA); upload the certificate signed by the CA using the <samp>POST /api/v2/https_certificates</samp> path. The certificate and paired key are used to authenticate communications with the Tanium Server, Tanium Module Server, and Tanium module services.

parameters.name: tanium-options

Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

Submit the CSR to a certificate authority (CA); upload the certificate signed by the CA using the <samp>POST /api/v2/https_certificates</samp> path. The certificate and paired key are used to authenticate communications with the Tanium Server, Tanium Module Server, and Tanium module services.

get.description: Retrieve all https_certificate objects on the server. The private keys are encrypted on the Tanium Server and not included in responses from the server.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
(Optional) Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all matching https_certificate objects on the server. If there are no objects, returns an empty array.

post.description:
Upload a CA-signed Tanium Server SSL certificate. The certificate and paired key are used to authenticate communications with the Tanium Server, Tanium Module Server, and Tanium module services.

Your certificate must be in PEM format. You must include the content of the certificate, excluding -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- and -----END CERTIFICATE-----.

requestBody.description: A string array including the certificate information to upload, and optional intermediate certificates, in Base64-encoded SSL/TLS certificate string value. Use the format {"certificates" : ["Base64-encoded-certificate-string","Base64-intermediate-cert-string-1","Base64-intermediate-cert-string-n"]} to pass certificate information.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

200.description: A data array that contains the new https_certificate object.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • HTTPSCertificateInvalid The uploaded HTTPS certificate does not match a private key stored on the Tanium Server.
  • InvalidJSONBody The format of the input JSON is not valid.

5XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • MustSpecifyCertificate The request does not include a certificate.
  • NoCertificateFound The request contained an invalid or non-OpenSSL server certificate.
  • OpenSSLError There is an error validating the certificate. Verify that you entered the correct content in the request.
  • UnexpectedListName The request contained an improper JSON element.

delete.description: Delete a zone server (zone_server object) that connects to the zone server hub with the specified server registration ID. This path sets the deleted_flag property to <samp>true</samp>, but does not remove the object from the server. Although the object still exists in the database, the object is no longer accessible through the API. To use this path, you must have an Administrator role, or you must have the "Manage Zone Servers" privilege.

parameters.name: hub_id
parameters.description: The server registration ID of the zone server hub.

parameters.name: zone_id
parameters.description: The ID of the zone server to delete.

200.description: A data object with a null value indicates the zone server was deleted.

get.summary: Get zone servers by hub ID
get.description: Retrieve the zone servers (zone_server objects) that connect to the zone server hub with the specified server registration ID. To use this path, you must have an Administrator role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The server registration ID of the hub.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of zone servers.

post.description: Create a zone server (zone_server object) to connect to the zone server hub with the specified server registration ID. To use this path, you must have an Administrator role.

requestBody.description: The zone server to create. The address property is required.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The server registration ID of the zone server hub.

200.description: A data object that contains the ID of the new zone server.

post.description:
Import objects from a JSON file. Users who are assigned a role with Import Signed Content permission can import signed content files. Users who have the Administrator reserved role can export and import all content types. Any user can import an object if the user has write permissions to the object. For example, if you have the Sensor write permission, you can import sensors. For more information, see Tanium Console User Guide: Authenticating content files.

Best Practice: In Tanium deployments with a lab license, Tanium Console notifies you if the file you selected to import is unsigned and lets you choose whether to proceed. However, the best practice is to not import unsigned files in any deployment.

You can include options to handle any import conflicts. If you do not pass any options, the server accepts the import only if there are no conflicts. If there are conflicts, the response includes an import_conflict_details report of the objects in the file and properties that differ for any conflicts. You need to resolve any conflicts and resubmit with the import_conflict_options option or the global default_import_conflict_option option.

Valid objects to import include:
  • content_set
  • content_set_privilege
  • content_set_role
  • content_set_role_privilege
  • dashboard
  • dashboard_group
  • group
  • ldap_sync_connector
  • package_spec
  • plugin
  • saved_action
  • saved_question
  • sensor
  • solution
  • white_listed_url


Notes:
  • If multiple saved_action objects with the same name are included in a single import, the server creates a separate saved_action object for each saved action. Any saved actions with duplicate names already on the server are deleted.
  • If you import saved questions, define the disabled_flag property as 1 for the saved questions to prevent the Tanium Server from automatically reissuing the saved questions. Define the disabled_flag property as 0 or exclude it from the saved question to allow the Tanium Server to automatically reissue the saved question.
  • If you import saved questions, the keep_seconds value is defined as the value associated with your user account and active persona, regardless of the value in the import file when imported.


If you post a deprecated XML solution file to /api/v2/import, the server upgrades the file and imports the file. If you want to import a deprecated file without upgrading the file to the current version, use the POST /api/v2/import/upgrade path to post the file; the server response is a JSON export file.

requestBody.description:
JSON that contains:
  • An array of objects to import, in JSON format. Use KeyUtility.exe to sign the JSON file before you import the file.
  • The import version.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • import_conflict_options: Specify how to handle import conflicts. You can specify a value for each object in the object_list, sorted by the plural object type. Values are handled in the order that the objects appear in the object_list. For possible values, see the import_conflict_options object.
  • import_conflict_options_by_type_and_name: Specify how to handle import conflicts by object type and name. You can specify a value for each object in the object_list, sorted by the singular object type. For possible values, see the import_conflict_options object.
  • import_analyze_conflicts_only: Set to 1 if you want the import to only preview conflicts.
  • default_import_conflict_option: Specify a value to use if you do not specify any import_conflict_options or import_conflict_options_by_type_and_name. If there are fewer options in the import_conflict_options than objects in the object_list, any option that you specify for default_import_conflict_option applies to the extra objects. For a list of possible values, see the import_conflict_options object.

parameters.name: prefer:respond-async
parameters.description: Include if you want the import request to respond asynchronously.

200.description: A data object that contains the imported objects. For asynchronous imports, the response is JSON containing the ID of the import, the start time, and the status. Use the ID with the <samp>GET /api/v2/import/{id}</samp> path to retrieve the current status of the import.

Possible responses include:
  • SignatureValidationFailed A signature is required to import the file.
  • UnsupportedExportVersion Set the version property to 2, and make sure the input JSON format is valid.
  • InvalidSensorScriptType [Sensor imports] The type of the sensor script is not valid.

get.description: Retrieve the status of an asynchronous import job.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the asynchronous import job to retrieve.

200.description:
A data object that contains the status information for the import job. Possible properties include:
  • end_time: The time when the import completed. Only included after the import completes.
  • exception: If the import failed (success is false), this property contains the error message.
  • id: The ID of the import job.
  • result: Contains a string with conflict details. Only included after the import completes.
  • start_time: The time when the import started.
  • status_text: Contains the current operation. Only included if the import is not complete.
  • success: Value is true if the import completed successfully, false if the import failed. Only included after the import completes.

4XX.description: ImportJobNotFound No import job matches the specified ID.

get.description: Retrieve the Tanium Server root public key (tanium.pub). Tanium Clients 7.2 or earlier use only the root public key to authenticate. Use this path to download the public key file from the Tanium Server that you can then deploy to the Tanium Clients, Zone Server, and Zone Server Hub.

200.description: The contents of the tanium-init.dat file.

get.description:
Retrieve the Tanium initialization bundle (tanium-init.dat).

The Zone Server, Zone Server Hub, and Tanium Clients must authenticate to the Tanium Server to enable communication with it. Version 7.4 of the servers and clients use keys that are inside the initialization bundle (tanium-init.dat) to authenticate. Use this path to download the initialization bundle from the Tanium Server that you can then deploy to the Tanium Clients, Zone Server, and Zone Server Hub. For best results, use the server_list parameter with a list of servers to include in the bundle. If you call this path without the server_list parameter, the response does not include server names, and you will need to configure the server name list.

parameters.name: server_list
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of Tanium servers. Include in the tanium-options wrapper.

200.description: The contents of the tanium-init.dat file

post.description:
This requires Tanium Core Platform 7.5.2 or later and Tanium Client version 7.4.7 or later.

Create the Tanium initialization bundle (tanium-init.dat) with custom settings as needed. The Zone Server, Zone Server Hub, and Tanium Clients must authenticate to the Tanium Server to enable communication with it. Version 7.4 or later of the servers and clients use keys that are inside tanium-init.dat to authenticate. Use this path to create and download the initialization bundle from the Tanium Server that you can then deploy to the Tanium Clients, Zone Server, and Zone Server Hub.

The following table describes the JSON format.

Properties

PropertyTypeRequiredDescription
namestringRequiredThe client setting name. For more information about client settings, see Tanium Client Management User Guide: Tanium Client settings and CLI.
overridebooleanOptionalSet to true to overwrite an existing setting. Set to false to leave an existing setting and not overwrite it. If undefined, this defaults to false.
valueboolean, number, or stringRequiredThe setting value.

requestBody.description: Specify custom settings for the tanium-init.dat file. See endpoint description for details.

200.description: The contents of the binary tanium-init.dat file.

4XX.description: InvalidJSONBody The format of the input JSON is not valid.

get.description: Retrieve all management rights groups (management_rights_group objects) on the server. Management rights groups with the deleted_flag property set to <samp>true</samp> are not included in the response.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • cache_expiration: Include to preserve the cache results for a number of seconds.
  • cache_filters: Include to limit the results returned.
  • cache_id: Include to reuse results from a previous request.
  • cache_sort_fields: Include a comma-separated list of fields to sort the cached results in ascending order. Prepend "-" to a field to sort in descending order. Use dot notation to sort on supported subfields. You can sort on the following:
    • name
  • include_computer_specs_flag: Set to 1 to include the computer_specs property for any manual groups.
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all management rights groups on the server and a cache_info object. If there are no management rights groups, the response only contains the cache_info.

post.description:
Create a management rights group (management_rights_group object).

Important: For best results, use POST /api/v2/management_rights_groups to create management rights groups, POST /api/v2/filter_groups to create filter groups, or POST /api/v2/groups to create other group types.

requestBody.description:
The management rights group to create. The name property is normally required. If you have one of the following privileges, you can exclude the name property to create an anonymous group:
  • Administrator reserved role
  • Content Administrator rserved role
  • Computer Group write permission
  • Ask Dynamic Questions permission (Tanium Interact)
  • Action write permission
If you reference a parameterized sensor in the management rights group, pass a comma-separated list of values in brackets ([]) after the sensor name in the text property.

200.description: A data object that contains a ResultXML object with merged result data.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • SavedQuestionNotFound No saved question matches the specified ID.

  • SingleColumnQuestionsNotAllowed The result data for the questions cannot be merged.

post.summary: Move content to different content set
post.description: Assign content to a different content set. You can specify multiple types of objects, and a different content set for each object. Note that if the path returns an error for an object, the other objects specified in the input JSON might still be successful.

requestBody.description: One or more arrays of objects that contains the IDs of the objects for which to move content sets, in addition to the IDs of the new content sets. You can specify a different content set for each object.

200.description: An empty data set is returned with a successful response.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • RBACInsufficientPrivilege Your user account does not have permission to change content sets for one or more specified objects. This error also appears if a target content set does not exist.
  • ObjectNotFound One or more specified objects do not exist on the server, or you do not have permission to edit the object. The text of the message changes based on the object that triggered the error (such as SensorNotFound).

parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • cache_expiration: Include to preserve the cache results for a number of seconds.
  • cache_filters: Include to limit the results returned.
  • cache_id: Include to reuse results from a previous request.
  • cache_sort_fields: Include a comma-separated list of fields to sort the cached results in ascending order. Prepend "-" to a field to sort in descending order. Use dot notation to sort on supported subfields. You can sort on the following:
    • available_time
    • command_timeout
    • content_set

    • display_name
    • expire_seconds
    • hidden_flag
    • id

    • parameter_definition

  • include_hidden_flag: Set to 1 to include deleted personas in the response.
  • include_persona_owned_object_ids_flag: Set to 1 to also retrieve the id and name values for each plugin_schedule, saved_action, and saved_question object owned by each persona.
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all packages on the server and a cache_info object. If there are no packages, returns an empty array.

post.description: Preview the effective content set privileges for one or more content_set_role and content_set_role_privilege objects. You can preview the content set privileges for existing roles and privileges, or provide the objects for new content_set_role objects. This path does not create any objects; use the <samp>POST /api/v2/content_set_roles</samp> path to create a content_set_role.

requestBody.description: A content_set_roles object that contains an array of content set roles. For each entry, you can reference an existing content set role by ID or by name, you can include a new content set role, or you can specify an existing content set role privilege. If you include the ID and name of an existing content set role in one entry, only the ID is used in case of conflicts (name is ignored). Any privileges specified in the input JSON must exist on the server.

two.summary: Example (show privileges for two existing content set roles)

five.summary: Example (show privileges for two existing content set roles, with serialize_authorization_flag=1)

six.summary: Example (show privileges for existing and new content set role)

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • serialize_authorization_flag: Set to 1 to serialize the effective privileges that are returned by this path. Use this option to reduce the footprint of the response.
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

200.description:
An array of concatenated effective privileges for all content set roles specified in the input JSON. This includes provided privileges and implied privileges. Properties returned in each entry might include:
  • id: The ID of the content_set_privilege
  • implied_by: For implied privileges, an array of privileges that imply this privilege
  • implied_on: For implied privileges, an array of content_set IDs to which the privilege applies
  • name: The name of the content_set_privilege
  • provided_by: For provided privileges, an array of privileges that provide this privilege
  • provided_on: For provided privileges, an array of content_set IDs to which the privilege applies
  • selected_flag: Value is false if the privilege is implied or provided, but not explicitly assigned; Value is true if the privilege is explicitly assigned (the privilege might still be implied or provided, see the implied_by and provided_by properties)
  • selected_on: When selected_flag is true, contains an array of content set IDs to which the explicit privilege applies.

one.summary: Example (show privileges for existing content set role)

two.summary: Example (show privileges for two existing content set roles)

five.summary: Example (show privileges for two existing content set roles, with serialize_authorization_flag=1)

six.summary: Example (show privileges for existing and new content set role)

You can preview the content set privileges for existing roles and privileges, or provide the new content_set_role objects. This path does not create any objects; use the <samp>POST /api/v2/content_set_roles</samp> path to create a content_set_role.

For each entry, you can reference an existing content_set_role by ID or by name, you can include the new content_set_role, or you can specify an existing content_set_role_privilege. If you include the ID and name of an existing content_set_role in one entry, only the ID is used in case of conflicts (name is ignored). Any privileges specified in the input JSON must exist on the server.

200.description:
A data object that contains an array of concatenated effective and rejected privileges for all content set roles specified in the input JSON. This includes provided privileges and implied privileges. Properties returned in each entry might include:

  • implied_by: For implied privileges, an array of privileges that imply this privilege
  • implied_on: For implied privileges, an array of content_set IDs to which the privilege applies
  • name: The name of the content_set_privilege
  • provided_by: For provided privileges, an array of privileges that provide this privilege
  • provided_on: For provided privileges, an array of content_set IDs to which the privilege applies
  • selected_flag: Value is false if the privilege is implied or provided, but not explicitly assigned; Value is true if the privilege is explicitly assigned (the privilege might still be implied or provided, see the implied_by and provided_by properties)
  • selected_on: When selected_flag is true, contains an array of content_set IDs to which the explicit privilege applies.

get.description: Retrieve all saved actions (saved_action objects) on the server.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • cache_expiration: Include to preserve the cache results for a number of seconds.
  • cache_filters: Include to limit the results returned.
  • cache_id: Include to reuse results from a previous request.
  • cache_sort_fields: Include a comma-separated list of fields to sort the cached results in ascending order. Prepend "-" to a field to sort in descending order. Use dot notation to sort on supported subfields. You can sort on the following:
    • action_group (subfield sort supported)
    • action_group_id
    • approved_flag
    • approver (subfield sort supported)
    • approver_id
    • approver_persona (subfield sort supported)
    • comment
    • distribute_seconds
    • end_time
    • expire_seconds
    • id
    • issue_seconds
    • last_start_time
    • name
    • package_spec (subfield sort supported)
    • persona (subfield sort supported)
    • policy_flag
    • start_time
    • status
    • user (subfield sort supported)
    • user_start_time
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all saved actions on the server and a cache_info object. If there are no saved actions, the response only contains the cache_info object.

get.description: Retrieve all scim_server objects configured on the server.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all scim_server objects on the server. If there are no objects, returns an empty array.

post.description:
Create a System for Cross-Domain Identity Management (SCIM) scim_server object. Your SCIM server uses this object and the associated api_token object to communicate with the Tanium Server. When you create a scim_server object using this path, a new api_token and user are also created and associated with this object. The user.name property is populated as scim_server.name SCIM User and the api_token.notes property is populated as scim_server.name.

Note: Copy the api_token.token_string value from the response body. You cannot retrieve it using the GET /api/v2/scim_servers/{id} path to retrieve the scim_server object.

requestBody.description: The scim_server object to create. A unique name property is required. The value of the expire_in_days property must be between <samp>1</samp> and <samp>365</samp>.

200.description: A data object that contains the new scim_server object. Note: Copy the api_token.token_string value from the response body; you cannot retrieve it using the <samp>POST /api/v2/scim_servers/{id}</samp> path to retrieve the scim_server object.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • InvalidJSONBody The format of the input JSON is not valid.
  • SCIMServerAlreadyExists Another scim_server object with the same name already exists. Select a different name or delete the existing scim_server object with the same name.
  • SCIMServerNameRequired The input JSON must contain the name property.

5XX.description: InvalidExpireInDaysField The value of the expire_in_days property must be between <samp>1</samp> and <samp>365</samp>.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • cache_expiration: Include to preserve the cache results for a number of seconds.
  • cache_filters: Include to limit the results returned.
  • cache_id: Include to reuse results from a previous request.
  • cache_sort_fields: Include a comma-separated list of fields to sort the cached results in ascending order. Prepend "-" to a field to sort in descending order. Use dot notation to sort on supported subfields. You can sort on the following:
    • category
    • content_set (subfield sort supported)
    • description
    • hash
    • hidden_flag
    • id
    • keep_duplicates_flag
    • max_age_seconds
    • name
    • source_id
  • include_hidden_flag: Set to 1 to include deleted personas in the response.
  • include_persona_owned_object_ids_flag: Set to 1 to also retrieve the id and name values for each plugin_schedule, saved_action, and saved_question object owned by each persona.
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.
  • summary: Set to 1 to reduce the properties returned in the results.

post.description: Create a sensor (sensor object).

requestBody.description: The sensor to create. A unique name property is required.

200.description: A data object that contains the ID of the new sensor.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • SensorNotFound The input JSON must contain all required properties.
  • SensorNameNotUnique Another sensor with the same name already exists. Select a different name or delete the existing sensor with the same name.
  • SensorNameTooLong The sensor name contains more than 256 characters.

5XX.description: SensorNameInvalid You cannot include <samp>linux:</samp> in a sensor name.

delete.description: Delete the sensor (sensor object) that matches the specified ID. Deleting a sensor sets the deleted_flag property to <samp>true</samp>, but does not remove the object from the server.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the sensor to delete.

200.description: A data object that contains the ID of the deleted sensor.

4XX.description: SensorNotFound No sensor matches the specified ID. Sensors with a deleted_flag property set to <samp>true</samp> also return this message.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • SensorNotFound No sensor matches the specified ID.
  • TooManyTagsWithSameName The input JSON cannot include the id property. The ID is already included as a query parameter.
  • CannotModifyReservedSensor A sensor with the category property set to Reserved cannot be modified, except for the max_string_age_minutes and max_strings properties.
  • RBACInsufficientPrivilege You either do not have permission to update the content, or the content cannot be updated. For example, content in the Reserved content set cannot be updated (except for the max_string_age_minutes and max_strings properties).
  • SensorNameInvalid You cannot include linux: in a sensor name.

get.description:
Retrieve all server registration requests (server_registration_request objects) on the server. Server registration requests are automatically created when servers try to register with the server.

To use this path, you must have an Administrator reserved role.

200.description: An array that contains all server registration requests on the server.

patch.summary: Update server registration request by ID
patch.description:
Update the server registration request (server_registration_request object) that matches the specified ID. Use this path to approve, reject, and revoke server registration requests. Only the following properties are editable:
  • approved_flag
  • rejected_flag
  • revoked_flag

To use this path, you must have an Administrator reserved role.

requestBody.description: A server registration request that contains the property to update. Do not specify more than one property in an update request.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the server registration request to update.

200.description: A data object that contains the updated server registration request.

get.description: Retrieve all server throttles (server_throttle objects) on the server.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all server throttles on the server. If there are no server throttles, returns an empty array.

post.description: Create a server throttle (server_throttle object). A server throttle controls the rate at which data is sent across all client connections. For example, use a server throttle to enforce policies such as "The server should never use more than 1 Mbps sending sensors to clients". Only one server throttle can be active on a server. The server uses the server throttle with the lowest ID property and no value in the ip_address property.

requestBody.description: The server throttle to create. If you specify a value for the ip_address property, the server will create the server throttle but will not make it active.

200.description: A data object that contains the new server throttle.

delete.description: Delete the server throttle (server_throttle object) that matches the specified ID. Deleting a server throttle sets the deleted_flag property to <samp>1</samp>, but does not remove the object from the server.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the server throttle to delete.

200.description: A data object that contains the ID of the deleted server throttle.

4XX.description: ServerThrottleNotFound No server throttle matches the specified ID.

get.description: Retrieve the server throttle (server_throttle object) that matches the specified ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the server throttle to retrieve.

200.description: A data object that contains the server throttle that matches the ID.

4XX.description: ServerThrottleNotFound No server throttle matches the specified ID.

patch.description: Update the server throttle (server_throttle object) that matches the specified ID.

requestBody.description: A server throttle that contains the properties to update. If you specify a value for the ip_address property, the server ignores the server throttle. Properties not included in the JSON are not updated. Any properties that you specify overwrite existing properties.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the server throttle to update.

200.description: A data object that contains the updated server throttle.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • ServerThrottleNotFound No server throttle matches the specified ID.
  • TooManyTagsWithSameName The input JSON cannot include the id property. The ID is already included as a query parameter.

get.description: Retrieve status of all server throttle statuses (server_throttle_status objects) on the server.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all server throttle statuses on the server. If there are no server throttle statuses, returns an empty array.

delete.description: Remove a specified server trust (server_trust object). This path allows the current server to stop trusting the target server, and any specified keys are revoked.

requestBody.description: A server trust that includes the server_guid of the target server and the fingerprints of the root keys for the target server.

200.description: No data is returned on success.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • InvalidJSONBody The input JSON is not valid.
  • PKIAABundleException No server matches the specified GUID.

5XX.description: ResolveHostFailed The system could not resolve the server host name because the host name is not valid or DNS is not working.

get.description: Retrieve the trust relationships (server_trust objects) between the current server and other Tanium servers in an active-active cluster. Relationships can indicate 2-way trusts, 1-way trusts, no trusts, or revoked trusts.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of server trusts. If there is only one Tanium server, returns an empty array.

5XX.description: ResolveHostFailed The system could not resolve the server host name because the host name is not valid or DNS is not working.

post.description: Create a trust relationship (server_trust object) between the current server and another Tanium server.

requestBody.description: A server trust that contains all the fingerprints of the root keys for the target server and its GUID. Any specified keys will be trusted and appear in the Root Key Management page.

200.description: A data object that contains the new server trust.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • InvalidJSONBody The input JSON is not valid.
  • PKIAABundleException Make sure the input JSON contains valid values for the server_guid and valid pki_root_keys properties.
  • TagNotFound Make sure the input JSON contains valid pki_root_key objects.

5XX.description: ResolveHostFailed The system could not resolve the server host name because the host name is not valid or DNS is not working.

get.description: Retrieve the trust relationship (server_trust object) between the current server and another server with the specified GUID.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: The GUID of the server for which to retrieve the server trust.

200.description: A data object that contains the server trust that contains the server trust relationship between the current server and the server with the specified GUID.

4XX.description: PKIAABundleException No server matches the specified GUID.

5XX.description: ResolveHostFailed The system could not resolve the server host name because the host name is not valid or DNS is not working.

post.description:
Create a new session for the specified persona. To use this path, you must already be signed in with a valid session string, and your user must be assigned to the persona. You can send a request to GET /api/v2/users/{id} or GET /api/v2/personas/{id} to verify the user is assigned to the persona. If the user is not assigned to the persona, use the PATCH /api/v2/personas/{id} path to add the user to the persona.
  • Sessions are independent of each other. After this path creates a new session for the specified persona, the original session remains active. If the original session is not needed, you should POST /api/v2/session/logout of the original session.
  • You can call this path from any valid session authenticated with a session string, including another persona for the same user. You cannot call this path from any session authenticated with an API token string.
  • The successful output of this path is always a session string. You can use the POST /api/v2/api_tokens to create an API token for the new session.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the persona to use to create the new session for the user.

200.description: A data object that contains the session string for the specified persona. Use this string as input for the remaining API paths.

4XX.description: InvalidPersona Make sure that the persona with the ID exists, and the user or user group is assigned to the persona object with the specified ID. To assign the user to an existing persona, use the <samp>PATCH /api/v2/personas/{id}</samp> path.

get.description: Retrieve details for the current user and session, including current persona.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.
  • serialize_authorization_flag: Set to 1 to serialize the effective_content_set_privileges for the user that is returned by this path. Use this option to reduce the reduce the footprint of the response.

200.description: A data object that contains the user for the current user, with session

get.summary: Get effective content set roles for current session
get.description: Retrieve all content set roles assigned to the current session and inherited from user groups to which the current session user belongs. The response contains effective_role objects, each containing the ID and name of a content set role.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of effective roles. If there are no effective roles, returns an empty array.

post.description: Sign in to the Tanium Server. On success, the server responds with a session string that is valid for five minutes. Additional requests to the server require the session string. Each request to the server resets the timeout of the session string back to five minutes. Use the <samp>POST /api/v2/session/validate</samp> path to check if the session string is still valid.

requestBody.description: An auth object that contains the sign-on information.

200.description: A data object that contains the session string. Use this string as input for the remaining API paths.

4XX.description: Verify the syntax of the request and that the server is running and reachable from the client.

post.description: Sign out of the Tanium Server. Use this path to end a session.

requestBody.description: The session string.

200.description: A data object that contains the session ID of the session that was signed out.

4XX.description: InvalidSession The session string is not valid. The session might already have ended.

get.summary: Get management rights for current session
get.description: Retrieve the management rights for the current session. A successful response returns a list of management rights groups (management_rights_group objects) to which the current user and persona have access.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of management rights groups.

post.description:
Check the session status to the Tanium Server.

Note: In Tanium Core Platform 7.4.3 and later, you can also use this path to validate an API token. In the input JSON, assign the API token string to the session key (see example).

Note: Depending on your security settings, you might need to pass authentication information in the header.

requestBody.description: The session string

parameters.name: session
parameters.description: The Tanium session string or the token string. Include if your configuration requires authentication. The session string is returned by the <samp>POST /api/v2/session/login</samp> and <samp>POST /api/v2/session/validate</samp> paths. The token string is returned by the <samp>POST /api/v2/api_tokens/</samp> path.

200.description: A data object that contains the current session string.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • InvalidSession The session string is not valid. The session might already have ended.
  • Unauthorized If authenticating with tokens, pass the token string in the header, verify the token string is valid and that the IP of the client is listed in the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting.

get.description: Retrieve all site throttles (site_throttle objects) on the server.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all site throttles on the server. If there are no site throttles, returns an empty array.

post.description: Create a site throttle (site_throttle object). A site throttle controls the rate at which data is sent to a list of subnets. For example, use a site throttle to enforce "The server should never send more than 5 Mbps to 192.168.0.0/16". Only the throttle for the site with the smallest IP address range applies to an endpoint that has an address within the ranges of multiple sites. If an endpoint matches multiple site throttles with the same size IP address range, then only the most recently created throttle applies.

requestBody.description: The site throttle to create.

200.description: A data object that contains the new site throttle.

delete.description: Delete the site throttle (site_throttle object) that matches the specified ID. Deleting a site throttle sets the deleted_flag property to <samp>1</samp>, but does not remove the object from the server.

parameters.description: The ID of the site throttle to delete.

200.description: A data object that contains the ID of the deleted site throttle.

4XX.description: SiteThrottleNotFound No site throttle matches the specified ID.

get.description: Retrieve the site throttle (site_throttle object) that matches the specified ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the site throttle to retrieve.

200.description: A data object that contains the site throttle that matches the ID.

4XX.description: SiteThrottleNotFound No site throttle matches the specified ID.

patch.description: Update the site throttle (site_throttle object) that matches the specified ID.

requestBody.description: A site throttle that contains the properties to update. Properties not included in the JSON are not updated. Any properties that you specify overwrite existing properties.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the site throttle to update.

200.description: A data object that contains the updated site throttle.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • SiteThrottleNotFound No site throttle matches the specified ID.
  • TooManyTagsWithSameName The input JSON cannot include the id property. The ID is already included as a query parameter.

get.description: Retrieve all system settings (system_setting objects) on the server.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • cache_expiration: Include to preserve the cache results for a number of seconds.
  • cache_filters: Include to limit the results returned.
  • cache_id: Include to reuse results from a previous request.
  • cache_sort_fields: Include a comma-separated list of fields to sort the cached results in ascending order. Prepend "-" to a field to sort in descending order. Use dot notation to sort on supported subfields. You can sort on the following:
    • allow_override_change
    • default_value
    • hidden_flag
    • name
    • override_flag
    • read_only_flag
    • server_setting_flag
    • value
  • include_hidden_flag: Set to 1 to include deleted personas in the response.
  • include_persona_owned_object_ids_flag: Set to 1 to also retrieve the id and name values for each plugin_schedule, saved_action, and saved_question object owned by each persona.
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

one.summary: Example tanium-options with json_pretty_pring and cache_filters

two.summary: Example tanium-options with cache_filter and cache sorting
