get.description: Retrieve the system status (system_status_list object) of the server.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • cache_expiration: Include to preserve the cache results for a number of seconds.
  • cache_filters: Include to limit the results returned.
  • cache_id: Include to reuse results from a previous request.
  • cache_sort_fields: Include a comma-separated list of fields to sort the cached results in ascending order. Prepend "-" to a field to sort in descending order. Use dot notation to sort on supported subfields. You can sort on the following:
    • host_name
    • ipaddress_client
    • ipaddress_server
    • protocol_version
    • full_version
    • last_registration
    • computer_id
    • send_state
    • receive_state
    • status
    • port
    • registered_with_tls
    • zone_server
    • registration_error
  • include_hidden_flag: Set to 1 to include deleted personas in the response.
  • include_persona_owned_object_ids_flag: Set to 1 to also retrieve the id and name values for each plugin_schedule, saved_action, and saved_question object owned by each persona.
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

two.summary: Example json_pretty_print, include_hidden_flag, cache_filters, and cache_sort_fields

200.description: A data object that contains the system_status_list object with system status information and a cache_info object.

post.description: Transfer the ownership of one or more objects to a different user.

requestBody.description: One or more arrays of objects that contains the IDs of the objects for which to transfer ownership, in addition to the ID of the new owning user. You can specify a different owner ID for each object.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
(Optional) Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • force_transfer_flag: Set to 1 to override any RBAC or computer management group restrictions for the target user. Available in Tanium Core Platform 7.4.5.1149 and later.

200.description: The results of the ownership transfer. The XML response does not contain a root element.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • InvalidUser REST Processing Exception: Invalid user has been specified as the new owner for object transfer.
  • ObjectNotFound REST Processing Exception: Owner of <object> <id> object is not found. Make sure the object ID is valid and the object has a current owner.
  • TransferNotAllowedForNonIdenticalUsers Unable to transfer ownership due to different computer management group rights or RBAC privileges between the current owner and the new owner. To override, use the force_transfer_flag option.

get.description: Retrieve the client status (client_status object) for clients that could not register with the Tanium Server.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all client statuses that failed to register with the Tanium Server. If all clients have successfully registered with the Tanium Server, returns an empty array.

post.description: Upload a local package file (upload_file object).

requestBody.description: An upload file. The file_size property is required.

one.summary: Example with bytes, file_size, and start_pos

start_chunks.description: For the first call, set id to <samp>-1</samp> and set bytes to an empty string. The file_size is the total file size before Base64 encoding, and must be accurate. Use the ID returned from the response to this call in subsequent calls.

first_chunk.description: Use the id value from initial call in this call and all subsequent calls. Use the same file_size value for all calls. Use unencoded sizes to calculate file_size and start_pos values. The bytes value must be Base64-encoded. Note that chunk sizes are usually larger. 512K is common. This example uses small chunks for readability.

last_chunk.description: Use the id value from the initial call in this call. Use the same file_size for all calls. The start_pos is the cumulative total of the unencoded sizes of previous chunks. In this example, the start_pos is the initial index (0) added to the size of the previous chunk (6000 bytes). For the final chunk, the response returns a hash value and file_cached is set to <samp>true</samp>.

200.description: A data object that contains the new upload file (upload_file object).

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • InvalidJSONbody The input JSON must contain a valid upload_file object.
  • FileSizeRequired The input JSON must contain the file_size property.
  • InvalidBase64 The bytes property in the input JSON must be Base64-encoded.

5XX.description: NotEnoughAvailableDiskSpace There is not enough free disk space to upload the file.

get.summary: Get upload file status by ID
get.description: Retrieve upload file status (upload_file_status object) by the ID of the upload file.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the upload_file object for which to retrieve status.

200.description: A data object that contains the upload_file_status object that matches the upload_file ID.

4XX.description: FileUploadNotFoundNotFound No upload file matches the specified ID.

post.description:
Upload a package file using file streaming. The response returns an uploaded file hash value. To include this file with a package, set package_spec.files.hash to this returned hash value. This path supports either the application/octet-stream or multipart/form-data content types, passed in an HTTP header.

If you define the application/octet-stream content type, specify a file to upload.

If you define the multipart/form-data content type, specify a file to upload in the form data.

requestBody.description:
A JSON object that contains:
  • The form data to pass in the request. Include the package file in the form data. Required only if multipart/form-data content type.
  • The package file to upload. Required only if application/octet-stream content type

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type. Define this as either <samp>application/octet-stream</samp> or <samp>multipart/form-data</samp>.

200.description: A data object that contains the uploaded package file size and file hash value. Set package_spec.files.hash equal to this hash value to include the uploaded file with a package.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • InvalidContentType The Content-Type HTTP header must equal either application/octet-stream or multipart/form-data.
  • ReceivedNoFormData Include a file as part of the request form data.
  • ExpectedOnlySingleFormData Ensure that the form data is properly defined and includes a file.

get.summary: Get effective content set roles by user ID
get.description: Retrieve all content set roles assigned to a user and inherited from user groups to which the user belongs. The response contains effective roles, each containing the ID and name of a content set role.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the user for which to retrieve effective content set roles.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of effective roles. If there are no effective roles, returns an empty array.

get.description: Retrieve all active users (user objects) on the server.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request.
(Required for Tanium Cloud) Required options for Tanium Cloud include:
  • summary: Set to 1 to reduce the properties returned in the results. By default, Tanium Cloud sets the UsersNonSummaryViewDisallowed global setting to 1.
(Optional) Available options include:
  • include_hidden_flag: Set to 1 to include deleted users in the response.
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.
  • serialize_authorization_flag: Set to 1 to serialize the effective_content_set_privileges for the users that are returned by this path. Use this option to reduce the footprint of the response.
  • summary: Set to 1 to reduce the properties returned in the results. If you set the UsersNonSummaryViewDisallowed global setting to 1, you must set this to 1.

200.description: A data object that contains an array of all users on the server. If there are no users, returns an empty array.

4XX.description: UsersNonSummaryViewDisallowed The UsersNonSummaryViewDisallowed global setting is set to 1. Include the summary=1 option with the request.

post.description: Create a user (user object). Note that Tanium Server uses external authentication, and does not store or manage its own set of user credentials.

requestBody.description: The user to create. A unique name property is required.

200.description: A data object that contains the new user.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • InvalidUserName The user name contains one of the following unsupported special characters: /\\[]:;|=,+*?<>
  • UserNameRequired The input JSON must contain the name property.
  • UserAlreadyExists The input JSON must contain a unique name property. Another user already contains the same name.

get.description: Retrieve the user (user object) that matches the specified name.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request.
(Required for Tanium Cloud) Required options for Tanium Cloud include:
  • summary: Set to 1 to reduce the properties returned in the results. By default, Tanium Cloud sets the UsersNonSummaryViewDisallowed global setting to 1.
(Optional) Available options include:
  • include_user_details: Set to 1 to return the user object (for each requested user) with additional details, such as active_session_count. Note additional details are always returned for the current user.
  • include_user_owned_object_ids_flag: Set to 1 to include a list of objects owned by the user.
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.
  • serialize_authorization_flag: Set to 1 to serialize the effective_content_set_privileges for the user that is returned by this path. Use this option to reduce the footprint of the response.
  • summary: Set to 1 to reduce the properties returned in the results. If you set the UsersNonSummaryViewDisallowed global setting to 1, you must set this to 1.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the user to retrieve.

200.description: The user that matches the name.

4XX.description: UserNotFound No user matches the specified name.

patch.description: Update the user (user object) that matches the specified name. Note that you cannot use this path to update the name property for a user. To update the name, use the <samp>PATCH /api/v2/users/{id}</samp> path.

requestBody.description: A user that contains the properties to update. Properties not included in the JSON are not updated. Any properties that you specify overwrite existing properties. For example, to add a permission for the user, include the list of existing permissions in addition to the new permissions.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the user to update.

200.description: A data object that contains the updated user.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • UserNotFound No user matches the specified name.
  • TooManyTagsWithSameName The input JSON cannot include the name property. The name is already included as a query parameter.

delete.description: Delete the user (user object) that matches the specified ID. Deleting a user sets the deleted_flag property to <samp>true</samp>, but does not remove the object from the server. You can undelete a user using <samp>PATCH /api/v2/users/{id}</samp> or <samp>PATCH /api/v2/users/by-name/{name}</samp> by changing the deleted_flag property to <samp>false</samp>.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the user to delete.

200.description: A data object that contains the deleted user. The deleted_flag property is set to <samp>true</samp>.

4XX.description: UserNotFound No user matches the specified ID.

get.description: Retrieve the user (user object) that matches the specified ID.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
Any options to send with the request.
(Required for Tanium Cloud) Required options for Tanium Cloud include:
  • summary: Set to 1 to reduce the properties returned in the results. By default, Tanium Cloud sets the UsersNonSummaryViewDisallowed global setting to 1.
(Optional) Available options include:
  • include_user_details: Set to 1 to return the user object (for each requested user) with additional details, such as active_session_count. Note additional details are always returned for the current user.
  • include_user_owned_object_ids_flag: Set to 1 to include a list of objects owned by the user.
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.
  • serialize_authorization_flag: Set to 1 to serialize the effective_content_set_privileges for the user that is returned by this path. Use this option to reduce the footprint of the response.
  • summary: Set to 1 to reduce the properties returned in the results. If you set the UsersNonSummaryViewDisallowed global setting to 1, you must set this to 1.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the user to retrieve.

200.description: A data object that contains the user that matches the ID.

4XX.description: UserNotFound No user matches the specified ID.

patch.description: Update the user (user object) that matches the specified ID. Note: You can use this path to change the name of another user, but not your own user name.

requestBody.description: A user that contains the properties to update. Properties not included in the JSON are not updated. Any properties that you specify overwrite existing properties. For example, to add a permission for the user, include the list of existing permissions in addition to the new permissions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the user to update.

200.description: A data object that contains the updated user.

4XX.description:
Possible responses include:
  • UserNotFound No user matches the specified ID.
  • TooManyTagsWithSameName The input JSON cannot include the id property. The ID is already included as a query parameter.

4XX.description: UserNotFound No user matches the specified ID.

200.description: A data object that contains an a null response.

404.description: MetadataItemNotFound The requested metadata could not be found. Metadata not found by the name:

post.description: Verify that a solution manifest, console-specific files, module-specific files, or platform-specific plugins are provided by Tanium, and valid for deployment to the Tanium Server. The Tanium Server verifies the Base64-encoded file signature and returns <samp>true</samp> or <samp>false</samp>. If you pass a file signature for verification and the Tanium Server does not verify the file, do NOT deploy it to the Tanium Server. Contact Tanium for assistance.

requestBody.description: An array of one or more verify_signature objects containing Base64-encoded file signatures to verify.

parameters.name: tanium-options
parameters.description:
(Optional) Any options to send with the request. Available options include:
  • json_pretty_print: Set to 1 to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request. You can also include this option as a query string parameter.

200.description: An array of the verified values (<samp>true</samp> or <samp>false</samp>) for each file signature.

4XX.description: InvalidJSONBody The format of the input JSON is not valid.

5XX.description: InvalidBase64 The file signature value was not encoded in Base64.

action.description: An action object contains a package to deploy and a group that defines the set of machines to receive the package. The server accepts an action for a package that requires parameters, even if you do not provide the parameters.

action_group.description: An action group to further limit the results. When the action is issued, this property is combined (AND) with the group specified in the target_group property.

approver_persona.description: The name and ID of the persona to approve the action, if any. If there is no persona, this property is omitted.

cache_row_id.description: The unique ID in the response cache.

creation_time.description: The date and time when this object was created in the database.

distribute_seconds.description: The number of seconds over which to deploy the action.

expiration_time.description: (Optional) The date and time when the action expires.

expire_seconds.description:
(Optional) How long from the start time of the action being issued before the action expires. If no value is specified, the action uses the expire_seconds value of the package_spec object. If neither the action nor the package_spec specify this property, the action expires immediately. If action.package_spec.process_group_flag = 1, the package command runs in a process group, and the Tanium Client terminates all processes in the group when the action expires. If action.package_spec.process_group_flag = 0, processes are not automatically terminated. The package author should make sure that the process exits in this case.

For the best results, calculate an expire_seconds value by adding the action.package_spec.package_file.download_seconds, action.package_spec.command_timeout, and action.distribute_seconds values.

history_saved_question.description: The saved question that tracks the results of the action.

id.description: The unique ID of the action object.

metadata.description: An array of metadata items that describe this object.

name.description: (Optional) The action name. For the best results, define unique action.name values.

package_spec.description: The package deployed by this action. The server accepts packages that require parameters, even if you do not specify the parameters; the server does not validate any parameters or their contents.

persona.description: The ID of the persona that was used to create the action. If there was no persona, this property is omitted.

priority.description:
(Optional) Set to 1 for actions deployed by a user whom is actively working, such as through Tanium Direct Connect or Tanium Screen Sharing. Set to 0 for normal priority actions, such as deployed actions for which a user is not actively waiting on the result. Set to -1 for lower priority actions, such as background tasks for lower priority maintenance. Default is 0.

Note: Do not set this value to 1 unless absolutely necessary. Setting too many actions to a priority of 1 negatively impacts system performance by deprioritizing core system tasks.

Note: Actions with a value of -1 eventually process. These lower priority actions are never discarded based on the priority of other actions.

saved_action.description: The saved action that this action was issued from, if any.

skip_lock_flag.description: If set to <samp>true</samp>, this enables locked clients to run this action. This is populated with the value of the package_spec.trueskip_lock_flag property.

start_time.description: The date and time when the action became active.

stopped_flag.description: Whether an action stop has been issued for this action. A value of <samp>true</samp> indicates an action stop was issued.

target_group.description: The group of machines to target. When the action is issued, this property is combined (AND) with the group specified in the action_group property.

user.description: The user who issued this action.

action_group.description: An action group to further limit the results. When the action is issued, this property is combined (AND) with the group specified in the target_group property.

approver_persona.description: The name and ID of the persona to approve the action, if any. If there is no persona, this property is omitted.

cache_row_id.description: The unique ID in the response cache.

creation_time.description: The date and time when this object was created in the database.

distribute_seconds.description: The number of seconds over which to deploy the action.

expiration_time.description: (Optional) The date and time when the action expires.

(Optional) How long from the start time of the action being issued before the action expires. If no value is specified, the action uses the expire_seconds value of the package_spec object. If neither the action nor the package_spec specify this property, the action expires immediately. If action.package_spec.process_group_flag = 1, the package command runs in a process group, and the Tanium Client terminates all processes in the group when the action expires. If action.package_spec.process_group_flag = 0, processes are not automatically terminated. The package author should make sure that the process exits in this case.

For the best results, calculate an expire_seconds value by adding the action.package_spec.package_file.download_seconds, action.package_spec.command_timeout, and action.distribute_seconds values.

name.description: (Optional) The action name. For the best results, define unique action.name values.

package_spec.description: The package deployed by this action. The server accepts packages that require parameters, even if you do not specify the parameters; the server does not validate any parameters or their contents.

stopped_flag.description: Whether an action stop has been issued for this action. A value of <samp>true</samp> indicates an action stop was issued.

target_group.description: The group of machines to target. When the action is issued, this property is combined (AND) with the group specified in the action_group property.

user.description: The user who issued this action.

action_group.description: One or more computer groups to which to apply an action.

and_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>1</samp> to combine the sets of computers in the groups property.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the action_group object.

created_time.description: The UTC time and date when the action_group object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created the action_group object.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the action_group is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the action_group is active.

groups.description: (Optional) An array of group objects to include.

id.description: The unique ID of the action_group object. This ID is generated by the server when the action_group is created.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the action_group object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the action_group object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the action_group object.

name.description: (Optional) The name of the object.

public_flag.description: (Optional) If the value is <samp>0</samp>, only administrators can see this action group. If the value is <samp>1</samp>, the users specified in the user_groups property can see this object.

user_groups.description: (Optional) An array of user_group objects that can see the action_group. This property is only valid if public_flag is <samp>1</samp>. An empty array means all users can see this action_group.

action_history.description: An action_history object contains the history of deployed action objects.
An array of action objects that have been deployed.

action_stop.description: Create an action_stop object to stop an action.

id.description: The unique ID of the action_stop object

api_token.description:
An authentication token that a user account can use across multiple sessions.

There are several global settings that affect api_token objects. You can edit these settings through the PATCH /api/v2/api/v2/system_settings/by-name/{name} and PATCH /api/v2/api/v2/system_settings/{id} paths:
  • The api_token_expiration_in_days setting controls how long a token is valid before it expires. Default is seven days, minimum is 1 day.
  • The api_token_trusted_ip_address_list setting controls the list of client IP addresses from which the Tanium server authenticates tokens. This list does not need to include the IP address of the Module server, because the Tanium Server always authenticates tokens from the Module server.
  • The api_token_string_length setting controls the length of the token string. Valid values are 64-1024.


Tips:
  • To allow any token to be used from any IP address in a lab environment, set the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting to 0.0.0.0/0. For optimal security, do not use this value in production environments.
  • To allow a specific token to be used from any IP address in a lab environment, set the trusted_ip_addressesproperty to 0.0.0.0/0. For optimal security, do not use this value in production environments.
  • Failed authentication attempts are signed in the <Tanium Server>/Logs/auth0.txt file.

created_time.description: The UTC time and date when the object was created.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the api_token is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the api_token is active.

expiration.description: The UTC time and date when this token expires.

expire_in_days.description: (Optional) The number of days before the token expires. You can set this value when you create the token to ignore the default expiration set by the api_token_expiration_in_days global setting. If this property is not set and the api_token_expiration_in_days global setting does not exist, the token expires after seven days.

id.description: The unique ID of the api_token object.

last_used_on.description: The UTC time and date when this token was last used to authenticate to the server.

name.description: (Optional) The name of the object.

notes.description: (Optional) Use this property to add any comments for the token.

persona.description: The name and ID of the persona associated with the api_token. Only the user and persona associated with this api_token can use the object for authentication. If there was no persona, the id is <samp>0</samp>.

token_string.description: The token string to use to authenticate the user. This property is only returned by the <samp>POST /api/v2/api_tokens/</samp> path.

trusted_ip_addresses.description: (Optional) A comma-separated list of IP addresses and CIDR addresses that can use the api_token. Note the api_token also allows connections from addresses specified in the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting.

user.description: The user account that was used to create the api_token. Only the user and persona associated with this api_token can use the object for authentication.

data.notes: My module token that expires in 30 days.

id.description: The unique ID of the archived_question object.

audit_data.description:
An entry in an audit log that shows data collected when an object is created, changed, or deleted. Timestamps are based on the database server time. For authentication audits, the audit_data shows an entry for a failed or successful sign-on attempt.

Note: Audit data is deleted according to the max_audit_data_expire_days global setting.

Note: The max_soap_audit_entries_per_cache global setting limits the number of audit entries to put into the server cache. The default value is 1,000,000.

audit_name.description: The event or object that generated the audit entry.

audit_row_id.description: The row ID from the database table. Use this value to identify audit entries.

creation_time.description: The UTC timestamp when this object was created in the database. For authentication audits, this property contains the UTC timestamp of the sign-on attempt.

details.description: Additional information regarding the collected data.

last_modified_by.description: The name of the user who last modified this object. This property is not used for authentication audits.

mod_user.description: The name of the user who last modified this object. This property is not used for authentication audits.

modification_time.description: The UTC timestamp of the last time that the object was modified. For authentication audits, this property contains the UTC timestamp of the sign-on attempt.

modifier_user_id.description: The unique ID of the user who last modified the object. This property is not used for authentication audits.

mod_persona.description: The persona who last modified this object, if any. This property does not appear when the default persona is used to modify the object. This property is not used for authentication audits.

object_id.description: The ID of the object that was modified. For authentication audits, this property contains the ID of the user who initiated the sign-on attempt. If the ID is <samp>0</samp>, the user does not exist; see the details property for more information.

object_name.description: The name of the object that was modified. This property is empty for authentication audits.

object_type_name.description: The type of audit entry. Use this property when using Connect to export audit entries of multiple types to identify the audit type for individual entries. For a list of possible values, see the <samp>GET /api/v2/audit_logs/{type}/{id}?start_time={time}&end_time={time}</samp> path, or use the <samp>GET /api/v2/audit_types</samp> path.

type.description:
The ID of type of action that initiated the audit entry.
  • 0 - create
  • 1 - update
  • 2 - delete
For authentication audits, the possible values are:
  • 0 - new session created
  • 1 - unused
  • 2 - user signed out
  • 3 - failed authentication

type_name.description: The type of action that initiated the audit entry, in string form.

example.details: User: TaniumAdmin; Session ID: 15070; Authentication Type: User; Originated from SOAPPluginScheduler

end_time.description: (Optional) Use to filter the number of entries.

entries.description: The entries contained in the audit log.

id.description: The unique ID of the audit_log object. When the id property is omitted, return one entry per unique object id. When the id property contains a value, use the audit_history_size option as a query parameter to control the number of the audit entries (default = 1).

start_time.description: (Optional) Use to filter the number of entries.

type.description: The type of audit log. For a list of possible values, see the <samp>GET /api/v2/audit_logs/{type}/{id}?start_time={time}&end_time={time}</samp> path, or use the <samp>GET /api/v2/audit_types</samp> path.

entries.details: Updated user group ID 4 with user ids: 2,4
Updated user group ID 4 with user ids: 2,4

auth.description: When authentication is successful, the server responds with a session property. Subsequent requests need only supply the session.  Each request extends the lifetime of the session. In some situations, the session string might change, so after each request the returned session string should be checked.

domain.description: (Optional) The domain of the user account.

secondary.description: (Optional) When using an authentication plugin, this can be additional information needed to authenticate (such as secure token ID / LDAP server).

cache_filters.description:
Use cache_filters to filter results returned by supported paths. To do so, specify a field, value, and operator for which to filter results. The filter property can also be a path to a particular element in the response XML, such as queries/query/platform.

Paths that support cache_filters include:
  • GET /api/v2/actions
  • GET /api/v2/audit_logs/{type}/{id}?start_time={time}&end_time={time}
  • GET /api/v2/dashboards
  • GET /api/v2/dashboard_groups
  • GET /api/v2/filter_groups
  • GET /api/v2/groups
  • GET /api/v2/management_rights_groups
  • GET /api/v2/packages
  • GET /api/v2/plugins
  • GET /api/v2/questions
  • GET /api/v2/saved_actions
  • GET /api/v2/saved_questions
  • GET /api/v2/sensors
  • GET /api/v2/system_settings
  • GET /api/v2/system_status

and_flag.description: (Optional) Only used when the sub_filters property contains a value. Set to <samp>0</samp> to require only one sub_filter to match (OR). Set to <samp>1</samp> to require all sub_filters to match (AND).

field.description: (Optional) Only return matches for this property. A property is normally specified unless you include sub_filters. To specify a nested property, use the forward slash character such as <samp>package_spec/name</samp>.

not_flag.description: (Optional) If set to <samp>1</samp>, the server only returns rows returned that do not match this filter. Default value is <samp>0</samp>.

operator.description:
(Optional) Defines how the values of the items being tested are compared against the value specified in the filter. Available operators are:
    RegexMatch: the item passes if its value matches the regular expression specified in the filter value
  • Less, Greater, LessEqual, GreaterEqual, Equal: the item passes if its value is Less, Greater, LessEqual, GreaterEqual, Equal to the filter value.
The default is Equal.

sub_filters.description: (Optional) An array of cache_filters. Supported for ResultData only. If specified, all other properties except not_flag and and_flag are ignored.

type.description:
(Optional) How the values are compared. Valid values include:
  • DataSize: values are expected to be an expression of an amount of data, such as 125MB or 23K or 34.2Gig (numeric + B|K|M|G|T units)
  • Date: a date in RFC 3339 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
  • IPAddress: values are expected to be IP addresses
  • Numeric: numeric comparison, including decimal, floating point, and scientific notation
  • NumericInteger: values are expected to be integer numeric values
  • String: standard lexicographical comparison (the default)
  • Version: values are expected to be version strings, such as 9.4.2 is less than 10.1.3

value.description: (Optional) The value to compare. A value is normally specified unless you include sub_filters.

cache_info.description:
The cache_info object contains generated metadata for an array of objects that support cache results

When you retrieve a list of objects that support cache results, the response includes the cache_info object. The cache_info contains information on the cache results, which includes an ID, the cache expiration, and row counts. You can use the cache results to retrieve different permutations of results from the same result set.

Prior to 7.4.1, cache results were linked to a session, meaning that unexpired cache results could only be retrieved with the same session ID. In 7.4.1, cache results are now linked to the user and persona who issued the original request.

cache_id.description: The ID of the cache created by the request.

cache_row_count.description: The number of rows in this cache before applying a filter.

errors.description: If there was a problem generating the XML, errors are listed here as xml_error objects.

expiration.description: The time that this cache expires.

filtered_row_count.description: The number of rows in this cache after applying a filter.

page_row_count.description: The number of rows returned in the current page.

client_count.description: The number of clients reporting to the server.

data.description: The number of clients reporting to the server.

client_status.description: Contains details about a client at the last time the client reported.

cache_row_id.description: The unique ID in the response cache.

computer_id.description: The computer ID of the client.

ipaddress_client.description: The IP address of the client returned from a sensor on the client.

ipaddress_server.description: The IP address of the client that was recorded on the server during the last registration.

last_registration.description: The most recent time that the client registered with the server.

port_number.description: The port number that the client uses to connect to peers.

public_key_valid.description: A value of <samp>false</samp> indicates a problem with the public key that has been installed with the Tanium Client. Redeploy the public key file or reinstall the Tanium Client.

registered_with_tls.description: A value of <samp>true</samp> indicates the client is registered through TLS.

registration_error.description: The reason that the Tanium Client could not register with the Tanium Server. If this client successfully registered with the Tanium Server, this property contains an empty string.

computer_specs.description: (Optional) An array of computer_group_spec objects that define the data collected for computers in the computer group.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the computer_group is deleted, <samp>false</samp> if the computer_group is active.

filter_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to if the group is a filter_group. The default is <samp>true</samp>.

id.description: The unique ID of the computer_group object.

management_rights_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> if the group is a management_rights_group. The default is <samp>true</samp>.

name.description: The unique name for the computer group.

computer_group_spec.description: A computer in a computer group. Data includes the computer name and IP address.

computer_name.description: The last reported name of the computer.

id.description: The unique ID of the computer_group_spec object.

ip_address.description: The last reported IP address of the computer.

content_set.description: A content set is a group of sensors, saved questions, dashboards, categories, and packages to which a permission applies. A content set is required for every sensor, package, saved question, dashboard, and dashboard group.

customer_privileges.description: When the restricted_customer_privileges_flag property is set to true, this property contains an array of privileges that are allowed for the content in the content set. Some content sets that are part of Tanium products only permit a limited set of privileges to be assigned to roles. For example, you might not have permission to modify sensors or packages in Tanium Patch, as that content is owned by Tanium and the Patch product. As a result, the Sensor write and Package write permissions are unavailable when configuring roles on a Tanium Patch content set.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the object is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the object is active.

description.description: (Optional) A description for the content set. The description appears in the user interface.

id.description: The unique ID of the content_set object.

metadata.description: An array of metadata_item objects that describe this object.

name.description: The name of the content set. The name appears in the user interface.

criteria.description:
A criteria object defines action exit codes associated with a package_spec object. You must define either a single exit_code value or a range of exit codes between inclusive_start_exit_code and inclusive_end_exit_code. You cannot define both a single exit_code and a range for a package.

For an action associated with a package_spec object with at least 1 exit code defined, if an action exit code matches the package_spec defined exit code, the action reports Succeeded. If the action exit code does not match the package_spec defined exit code, the action reports NotSucceeded. If there is a verification question, the action evaluates matching exit codes before evaluating the question to determine action status. If the package does not define any exit codes, the action returns status without reference the exit code.

exit_code.description:
Required for single exit code. A single exit code that corresponds to an action status of Succeeded.
You cannot define inclusive_start_exit_code or inclusive_end_exit_code if you define this value.

inclusive_start_exit_code.description:
Required for exit code range. The lower exit code in a range that corresponds to an action status of Succeeded.
If you define this, you must also define an inclusive_end_exit_code value. You cannot define an exit_code value if you define this value.

inclusive_end_exit_code.description:
Required for exit code range. The upper exit code in a range that corresponds to an action status of Succeeded.
If you define this, you must also define an inclusive_start_exit_code value. You cannot define an exit_code value if you define this value.

filter.description: The filter object is used by other objects to filter results. The filter object is not a standalone object; you can add the filter when you create the parent object.

all_values_flag.description: (Optional) If the value is <samp>true</samp>, a plural item passes the filter only if all of its values pass the filters. By default, a plural item passes if any of its values passes.

delimiter.description: (Optional) A single-character delimiter. If delimiter is not empty, then the item value is expected to be a list of values separated by the delimiter and the actual value tested is the item whose index is specified in the delimiter_index. Use this property with the sensor.subcolumns property.

delimiter_index.description: (Optional) The index of the item to test against. Used in conjunction with the delimiter property.

ignore_case_flag.description: (Optional) Unlike most flags, this defaults to <samp>true</samp> which means case is ignored by default.

max_age_seconds.description: (Optional) How old a sensor result can be before it is no longer considered valid. Default is <samp>0</samp>, which means to use the sensor.max_age property.

not_flag.description: (Optional) If the value is <samp>true</samp>, negate the match.

operator.description:
(Optional) Defines how the values of the items being tested are compared against the value specified in the filter. Available operators are:
  • HashMatch: the item passes if the hash of its value matches the filter value (this is the default)
  • RegexMatch: the item passes if its value matches the regular expression specified in the filter value
  • Less, Greater, LessEqual, GreaterEqual, Equal: the item passes if its value is Less, Greater, LessEqual, GreaterEqual, Equal to the filter value.

sensor.description: (Optional) When a filter is applied to clients, the values of this sensor are tested.

substring_flag.description: (Optional) If <samp>true</samp>, the substring of the items value specified by substring_start and substring_length is tested instead of the value of the item itself.

substring_length.description: (Optional) The length of the string in the value to compare. Used in conjunction with the substring_start.

substring_start.description: (Optional) The index in the value to begin the string comparison. Used in conjunction with the substring_length.

value.description: (Optional) Depending on the operator, this is the regular expression to match, the hash to match, or the value to compare against.

value_type.description:
(Optional) Specify how the values are compared. This does not apply if the operator is HashMatch or RegexMatch. The default is the result type of the sensor.
  • String: standard lexicographical comparison (the default)
  • Version: values are expected to be version strings, for example 9.4.2 is less than 10.1.3
  • Numeric: numeric comparison, including decimal, floating point, and scientific notation
  • BESDate: values are expected to be valid BES date strings
  • IPAddress: values are expected to be IP addresses
  • WMIDate: values are expected to be valid WMI date strings
  • TimeDiff: values are expected to be an expression of an amount of time, such as "2 years, 3 months, 18 days, 4 hours, 22 minutes, and 3.67 seconds" or "4.2 hours" (numeric + "Y|MO|W|D|H|M|S" units)
  • DataSize: values are expected to be an expression of an amount of data, such as 125MB or 23K or 34.2Gig (numeric + B|K|M|G|T units)
  • NumericInteger: values are expected to be integer numeric values

filter_group.description:
Important: For best results, use the filter_group object for filter groups, the management_rights_group object for management rights groups, or the group object for all other group types.

The values for the filter_flag and management_rights_flag properties control the group object behavior. Review the following for group creation best practices:
  • If the management_rights_flag and the filter_flag properties are 0, use the group object to create a group (POST /api/v2/groups).
  • If the management_rights_flag is 0 and the filter_flag is 1, use the filter_group object to create a filter group (POST /api/v2/filter_groups).
  • If the management_rights_flag is 1 and the filter_flag is 0, use the management_rights_group object instead to create a management rights group (POST /api/v2/management_rights_groups).
  • If the management_rights_flag and the filter_flag properties are 1, use the group, filter_group, or management_right_group object.

Use filter_group objects to filter question results, filter which endpoints process a question, and filter various lists in Tanium Console (such as the Administration > Users page). The membership of a filter_group is calculated by testing each candidate item and either including it or excluding it from the filter_group. First, items are checked to see if they are a member of all of the sub_groups (and_flag=true), or any of the subgroups (and_flag=false). Second, items are checked to see if they pass all of the filters (and_flag=true), or any of the filters (and_flag=false). If the not_flag is true, the members of the group are all the items that would have normally been excluded. Note that if no sub_groups are specified, all items are included. If no filters are specified, all items are included, so an "empty" group means "All".

and_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to AND all sub_groups. Set to <samp>false</samp> to OR all sub_groups.

content_set.description: (Optional) The content_set assigned to the filter_group.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the filter_group object.

created_time.description: The UTC time and date when the filter_group object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created the filter_group object.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the filter_group is deleted, <samp>false</samp> if the filter_group is active.

filter_flag.description: (Optional) A value of <samp>true</samp> indicates this is a filter_group. This property is automatically set when you create the filter_group through the <samp>POST /api/v2/filter_groups</samp> path.

filters.description: (Optional) An array of filter objects that define the criteria for clients to be eligible for the filter_group.

id.description: The unique ID of the filter_group object.

management_rights_flag.description: A value of <samp>true</samp> indicates this is a management_rights_group.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the filter_group object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the filter_group object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the filter_group object.

name.description: (Optional) A name is optional, and by default, filter groups are anonymous. If a name is supplied when you create or update the filter_group, the name must be unique.

not_flag.description: (Optional) If set to <samp>true</samp>, the members of the group are all the items that would have normally been excluded.

parameters.description: (Optional) An array of parameter objects to substitute into the source group.

saved_question_id.description: The ID of the saved question that tracks computer IDs in this filter_group. The saved question could be created due to tracking of the user.effective_group_id, or the persona.group_id if track_computer_id_flag is set to <samp>1</samp>.

source_id.description: (Optional) The source ID of the filter_group for parameterized groups.

sub_groups.description: (Optional) An array of child group objects. When you use the <samp>GET /api/v2/filter_groups</samp> path, you can apply cache_filters to this property to limit results.

text.description: (Optional) A description of the clients that this filter_group represents.

track_computer_id_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>1</samp> to enable the saved question that tracks the computer ID. Named groups only.

track_computer_id_interval.description: (Optional) How often to issue the saved question to track computer IDs, in seconds. Use this option when track_computer_id_flag is <samp>1</samp>. Default is 4 hours; minimum is 1 hour. Named groups only. If there are multiple originators (such as user or persona) for tracking, the server uses the most aggressive frequency to create or update the tracking saved question.

type.description:
(Optional) The type of the group. The group object is a parent object for other group types, including action groups, manual groups, filter groups, and management rights groups. Possible values:
ValueTypesDescription
0group
filter_group
management_rights_group		A computer group where the membership is based on the results of a sensor filter expression, such as is Windows equals true. Group objects with a type of 0 include group, filter_group, and management_rights_group.
1action_groupAn action group includes one or more computer groups for which to apply an action.
2Action policy pair groupThis group type does not have an associated object through the API.
3Ad hoc groupThis group type does not have an associated object through the API.
4Manual group (computer_group)A computer group where the membership is manually defined with a list of computer names or IP addresses.

group.description:
Important: For best results, use the filter_group object for filter groups, the management_rights_group object for management rights groups, or the group object for all other group types.

The values for the filter_flag and management_rights_flag properties control the group object behavior. Review the following for group creation best practices:
  • If the management_rights_flag and the filter_flag properties are 0, use the group object to create a group (POST /api/v2/groups).
  • If the management_rights_flag is 0 and the filter_flag is 1, use the filter_group object to create a filter group (POST /api/v2/filter_groups).
  • If the management_rights_flag is 1 and the filter_flag is 0, use the management_rights_group object instead to create a management rights group (POST /api/v2/management_rights_groups).
  • If the management_rights_flag and the filter_flag properties are 1, use the group, filter_group, or management_right_group object.

A group object is a computer group whose membership is defined through filters or manually.

The membership of a filter-based computer group is calculated by testing each candidate item and either including it or excluding it from the group. First, items are checked to see if they are a member of all of the sub_groups (if and_flag is set), or any of the subgroups (if and_flag is not set). Second, items are checked to see if they pass all of the filters ( if and_flag is set), or any of the filters (if and_flag is not set). If the not_flag is set the members of the group are all the items that would have normally been excluded. Note that if no sub_groups are specified, all items are included. If no filters are specified, all items are included, so an "empty" group means "All". See POST /api/v2/groups, PATCH /api/v2/groups/{id}, or PATCH /api/v2/groups/by-name/{name} for more information.

For a manual computer group, you define the membership when creating or updating the group. See the POST /api/v2/computer_groups, PATCH /api/v2/computer_groups/{id}, and PATCH /api/v2/computer_groups/by-name/{name} paths for more information.

and_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to AND all sub_groups. Set to <samp>false</samp> to OR all sub_groups.

content_set.description: (Optional) The content_set assigned to the group.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the group is deleted, <samp>false</samp> if the group is active.

filter_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to if the group is a filter_group. The default is <samp>true</samp>.

filters.description: (Optional) An array of filter objects that define the criteria for clients to be eligible for the group.

id.description: The unique ID of the group object.

management_rights_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> if the group is a management_rights_group. The default is <samp>true</samp>.

name.description: (Optional) A group name is optional, and by default groups are anonymous. If a name is supplied when you create or update the group, the name must be unique.

not_flag.description: (Optional) If set to <samp>true</samp>, the members of the group are all the items that would have normally been excluded.

parameters.description: (Optional) An array of parameter objects to substitute into the source group.

saved_question_id.description: The ID of the saved question that tracks computer IDs in this group. Named Group Only.

source_id.description: (Optional) The source ID of the group for parameterized groups.

sub_groups.description: (Optional) An array of child group objects. When you use the <samp>GET /api/v2/groups</samp> path, you can apply cache_filters to this property to limit results.

text.description: (Optional) A description of the clients that this group represents.

track_computer_id_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>1</samp> to enable the saved question that tracks the computer ID. Named groups only.

track_computer_id_interval.description: (Optional) How often to issue the saved question to track computer IDs, in seconds. Use when track_computer_id_flag is <samp>1</samp>. Default is 4 hours; minimum is 1 hour. Named groups only. If there are multiple originators (such as user or persona) for tracking, the server uses the most aggressive frequency to create or update the tracking saved question.

(Optional) The type of the group. The group object is a parent object for other group types, including action groups, manual groups, filter groups, and management rights groups. Possible values:
ValueTypesDescription
0group
filter_group

Important: For best results, use the filter_group object for filter groups, the management_rights_group object for management rights groups, or the group object for all other group types.

  • If the management_rights_flag is 0 and the filter_flag is 1, use the filter_group object to create a filter group (POST /api/v2/filter_groups).
  • If the management_rights_flag is 1 and the filter_flag is 0, use the management_rights_group object instead to create a management rights group (POST /api/v2/management_rights_groups).
  • If the management_rights_flag and the filter_flag properties are 1, use the group, filter_group, or management_right_group object.
