https_certificate.description: The SSL/TLS certificate used to authenticate communications with the Tanium Server, Tanium Module Server, and Tanium module services. This object is available only for on-premises deployments.

certificates.description: Input-only, required for the <samp>POST /api/v2/https_certificates</samp> path. A string array that includes the certificate information to upload, and optional intermediate certificates in Base64-encoded SSL/TLS certificate string value.

issuer.description: The server certificate issuer Distinguished Name.

matches_private_key_flag.description: If set to <samp>true</samp>, then the certificate matches a private key stored on the Tanium Server.

not_after_time.description: The server certificate Validity Not After date and time.

not_before_time.description: The server certificate Validity Not Before date and time.

public_key.description: The server certificate hexadecimal-encoded public key.

subject_alternative_names.description: An array of server certificate Subject Alternative Names.

https_certificate_name.description: The Distinguished Name associated with the https_certificate object. This object is available only for on-premises deployments.

https_certificate_signing_request.description: The SSL/TLS certificate signing request, used by a Certificate Authority to sign the associated https_certificate object. This object is available only for on-premises deployments.

subject_alternative_names.description: (Optional) An array of server certificate Subject Alternative Names.

id_reference.description: An object ID that can be referenced by another object.

id.description: (Optional) The object ID.

name.description: (Optional) Can optionally be a reference by name on input, when supported.

import_conflict_options.description: Specify how to handle import conflicts.

import_conflict_option.description:
(Optional)
  • 0 = Conflict error
  • 1 = Overwrite
  • 2 = Create copy
  • 3 = Ignore
  • 4 = Merge and overwrite (dashboard_group objects only)
  • 5 = Overwrite and disable (saved_action objects only)

intentional_subnet.description:
An intentional subnet containing one or more CIDR ranges that you define on the Tanium Server. Tanium Clients in an intentional subnet peer with other clients in the intentional subnet based on their external IP address. You can define an intentional subnet neighborhood, which aggregates all CIDR ranges across all intentional_subnet objects with the same neighborhood.

For information about intentional subnets, or to configure an intentional subnet for a Tanium Zone Server, see Tanium Console User Guide: Configuring Tanium Client subnets.

comment.description: (Optional) A description for the intentional_subnet object.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the intentional_subnet object.

created_time.description: The UTC time and date when the intentional_subnet object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created the intentional_subnet object.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the object is deleted, <samp>false</samp> if the object is active.

id.description: The unique ID of the intentional_subnet object.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the intentional_subnet object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the intentional_subnet object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the intentional_subnet object.

neighborhood.description: The name for a network neighborhood. When evaluating an intentional subnet, the system includes the CIDR ranges of all intentional subnet objects with the same neighborhood value.

subnets.description: An array of range objects, each defining a CIDR range. You must define at least one range object, and can define more than one per intentional_subnet object.

isolated_subnet.description:
An isolated subnet on the Tanium Server. Tanium Clients in an isolated subnet do not peer with any other clients, including other clients in the same subnet.

For information about isolated subnets, or to configure an isolated subnet for a Tanium Zone Server, see Tanium Console User Guide: Configuring Tanium Client subnets.

cidr_string.description: The subnet to isolate, in CIDR format.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the isolated_subnet object.

created_time.description: The date and time when the isolated_subnet object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created the isolated_subnet object.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the isolated_subnet is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the isolated_subnet is active.

id.description: The unique ID of the isolated_subnet object.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the isolated_subnet object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the isolated_subnet object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the isolated_subnet object.

name.description: (Optional) A name that you can use to identify the isolated_subnet object.

key_parameters.description: Private key parameters requested in a https_certificate_signing_request object. This object is available only for on-premises deployments.

curve.description: (Optional) The Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (EDCSA) type. If type is not set to <samp>EC</samp>, this value has no effect. If undefined, this defaults to <samp>prime256v1</samp>.

size.description: (Optional) The private key size in bits. If undefined, this defaults to <samp>2048</samp>.

type.description: (Optional) The private key encryption algorithm. Valid values are <samp>RSA</samp> (Rivest-Shamir-Adleman) or <samp>EC</samp> (elliptic curve). If undefined, this defaults to <samp>RSA</samp>

ldap_sync_connector.description: Integrate with LDAP or Active Directory servers to synchronize your enterprise users and user groups with the Tanium Server and to authenticate users. For information about how the Tanium Core Platform supports LDAP, see Tanium Console User Guide: Integrating with LDAP servers.

base_groups.description:
(Optional) The base DN for the user groups container. The Tanium Server synchronizes groups from all locations below this path. If setting base_groups or base_users to the root of a domain produces errors, set the disable_referrals_flag property to 1.

Example: CN=Users,DC=domain.

base_users.description:
(Optional) The base DN for users. The Tanium Server synchronizes users from all locations below this path. If setting base_groups or base_users to the root of a domain produces errors, set the disable_referrals_flag property to 1. Tanium Appliance Note: If you use a Tanium Appliance, the values for base_users and base_groups cannot be the root of a domain.

Example: cn=Users,dc=tam,dc=local.

disable_ldap_auth.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>1</samp> to use the configured server as the authentication source. Otherwise, the Tanium Server uses the LDAP server only to synchronize users and groups, and for authentication uses whatever other method you configured.

disable_referrals_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>0</samp> to allow referrals, set to <samp>1</samp> to disable referrals. You must disable referrals if the LDAP server is a Microsoft Active Directory server.

enable.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>0</samp> to disable the connector, set to <samp>1</samp> to enable the connector. If the configuration is enabled, synchronization occurs every 5 minutes. If the configuration is disabled, the users and user groups that were previously imported are deleted at the next sync time (within 5 minutes). If the configuration is subsequently re-enabled, the users and user groups are re-added, with the same object ID that they were initially assigned.

filter_groups.description: (Optional) The LDAP server uses this property to filter the user groups in the base_groups property. For example, if you enter <samp>objectClass=group</samp>, the LDAP server returns groups only if their objectClass attribute is set to <samp>group</samp>. You can use the backslash (\) to escape special characters in a group name. For Windows, use one backslash (<samp>name=\#myGroup</samp>). For Tanium Appliances, use two backslashes (<samp>name=\\#myGroup</samp>).

filter_users.description:
(Optional) The LDAP server uses this property to filter the users in the base_users property. For example, if you enter objectClass=user, the LDAP server returns users only if their objectClass attribute is set to user.

To exclude an account from synchronization, use the following filter, where <account_name> is the username:
((&(objectClass=user)(!(sAMAccountName=))))

If you add an LDAP server for the local authentication service of a Tanium Server running on a Tanium Appliance, you must use the following user filter:
(&(objectClass=person)(uidNumber>=20000))

group_id.description: (Optional) Enter the attribute (such as <samp>objectGUID</samp>) that uniquely identifies each user group. The value is case sensitive.

group_member.description: (Optional) Enter the user group attribute (such as <samp>member</samp>) that indicates which users are members. This value is case sensitive.

group_name.description: (Optional) Enter the attribute (such as <samp>cn</samp>) that identifies the name of a user group. This value is case sensitive.

host.description: (Optional) Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) or IP address for the LDAP server. If you connect using LDAPS, the value must match the hostname value in the LDAP server certificate. You must enter IPv6 addresses within square brackets (for example, <samp>[2001:db8::1]</samp>).

id.description: The unique ID of the ldap_sync_connector object.

last_sync_result.description: The status of the last synchronization between the Tanium Server and the LDAP server.

last_sync_timestamp.description: The timestamp of the last synchronization between the Tanium Server and the LDAP server.

ldap_password.description: (Optional) If use_ntlm is <samp>0</samp>, specify the password of the service account that the Tanium Server uses to query the LDAP server. The password is encrypted on the Tanium Server and is not included in responses from the server.

ldap_sync_state.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>1</samp> to pause synchronization without fully disabling the configuration (authentication continues to work). Set to <samp>0</samp> to resume synchronization.

ldap_user.description: (Optional) If use_ntlm is <samp>0</samp>, specify the username of the service account that the Tanium Server uses to query the LDAP server.

members_only_flag.description: (Optional) The LDAP server returns all users to the Tanium Server if they match the value of the filter_users property; the LDAP server does not filter by the user_member_of property. The Tanium Server then discards any users if none of the synchronized user groups have the user DN specified in the group_member property. This option is intended as a backup in cases where the LDAP server does not support filtering by the user_member_of property.

name.description: The name to identify the LDAP server.

port.description: (Optional) The port on which your LDAP server listens for its inbound LDAP traffic. The standard port for LDAP is 389, and the standard port for LDAPS/SSL is 636.

secure.description:
(Optional) Select one of the following options:
  • 0 - No encryption. Do not use in production.
  • 1 - Sign and encrypt. The LDAP connector turns on the LDAP_OPT_SIGN and LDAP_OPT_ENCRYPT session options. The session is encrypted, but it does not use TLS. Use this option only for Tanium Server on Windows and the external LDAP server is an AD server.
  • 2 - StartTLS. The LDAP connector calls ldap_start_tls_s to set up a TLS connection. You can use this option with Tanium Server on Windows or the Tanium Appliance.
  • 3 - LDAPS. The LDAP connector initiates an SSL connection to the LDAPS server.

sync_individual_members_flag.description: (Optional) By default, the LDAP server searches for users to synchronize based on the base_users value. However, if your LDAP implementation does not allow for a base user group that lists all users, set this property to <samp>1</samp> to skip the base_users search. Instead, this option directs the LDAP server to search for the DN of each user group member based on the group_member property. The users must still match the filter_users property, which can exclude group members that are computers or other groups.

user_display_name.description: (Optional) Enter the attribute that identifies the display name for users (typically <samp>displayName</samp>).

user_domain.description: (Optional) Enter the domain that the Tanium Server uses to match users in the Tanium database. Specify a NetBIOS name to match users who sign in with the <domain>\\<username> format (such as <samp>example-corp\user1</samp>) or specify a <domain>.<top-level_domain> name to match users who sign in using the <username>@<domain.top-level_domain> format (such as <samp>user1@example-corp.com</samp>). Either domain format matches users who sign in with only their username.

user_group_key.description:
(Optional) Specify the user attribute that LDAP uses to determine group membership. For example, if LDAP uses the user.objectGUID attribute as the value in the group.members property, set this property to objectGUID.

The default value is distinguishedName.

user_id.description: (Optional) The attribute that uniquely identifies each user. This property is case sensitive. Example: <samp>objectGUID</samp>

user_member_of.description: (Optional) Specify an LDAP attribute (such as <samp>memberOf</samp>) to exclude users who are not assigned to user groups that are synchronized with the Tanium Server. You must enter an attribute name, not an expression. The LDAP server returns users only if they have a value (DN) for that attribute that matches one of the groups from the group search. Selecting this option is the best practice because filtering on the LDAP server is faster and results in less network traffic than filtering on the Tanium Server. Most LDAP servers support this option.

user_name.description: (Optional) Enter the attribute that identifies the name of a user. The value that the Tanium Server imports for this property becomes the username that users type to sign into Tanium Console. Be sure to specify the attribute that is suitable for this purpose and be sure to communicate the expected form to your users. Use <samp>sAMAccountName</samp> for AD providers and <samp>cn</samp> for other LDAP providers. The value is case sensitive.

use_ntlm.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>1</samp> to use Microsoft NT LAN Manager (NTLM) for the connection with the LDAP server. The default is <samp>1</samp>. Using NTLM is a best practice when the Tanium Server is installed on a Windows Server and the connection is to an AD server. If you use NTLM, the Tanium Server service account is used, and you do not need to configure an LDAP User Name or LDAP Password. The LDAP server must allow this account to query with the configured filter expressions.

local_setting.description: A local setting is a Tanium Server setting that controls communication between the server and other Tanium Core Platform components or external servers, and also control features such as logging. This object is returned by the <samp>GET /api/v2/local_settings/by-name/{name}</samp> path.

name.description: (Optional) The name of the local setting. This name appears in the user interface.

value.description: (Optional) The current value of the local setting.

type.description: (Optional) Protected values are encrypted and return (protected) by default. To retrieve protected values, use the <samp>show_protected=1</samp> option.

management_rights_group.description:
Important: For best results, use the filter_group object for filter groups, the management_rights_group object for management rights groups, or the group object for all other group types.

The values for the filter_flag and management_rights_flag properties control the group object behavior. Review the following for group creation best practices:
  • If the management_rights_flag and the filter_flag properties are 0, use the group object to create a group (POST /api/v2/groups).
  • If the management_rights_flag is 0 and the filter_flag is 1, use the filter_group object to create a filter group (POST /api/v2/filter_groups).
  • If the management_rights_flag is 1 and the filter_flag is 0, use the management_rights_group object instead to create a management rights group (POST /api/v2/management_rights_groups).
  • If the management_rights_flag and the filter_flag properties are 1, use the group, filter_group, or management_right_group object.

A management_rights_group object is a group that is used to limit computer groups to items that a user is able to access. The membership of a management_rights_group is calculated by testing each candidate item and either including it or excluding it from the management_rights_group. First, items are checked to see if they are a member of all of the sub_groups (if and_flag is set), or any of the subgroups (if and_flag is not set).Second, items are checked to see if they pass all of the filters ( if and_flag is set), or any of the filters (if and_flag is not set).If the not_flag is set, the members of the group are all the items that would have normally been excluded. Note that if no sub_groups are specified, all items are included. If no filters are specified, all items are included, so an "empty" group means "All".

and_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to AND all sub_groups. Set to <samp>false</samp> to OR all sub_groups.

content_set.description: (Optional) The content_set assigned to the management_rights_group.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the management_rights_group object.

created_time.description: The UTC time and date when the management_rights_group object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created the management_rights_group object.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the management_rights_group is deleted, <samp>false</samp> if the management_rights_group is active.

filter_flag.description: (Optional) A value of <samp>true</samp> indicates this is a filter_group.

filters.description: (Optional) An array of filter objects that define the criteria for clients to be eligible for the management_rights_group.

id.description: The unique ID of the management_rights_group object.

management_rights_flag.description: A value of <samp>true</samp> indicates this is a management_rights_group. This property is automatically set when you create the management_rights_group.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the management_rights_group object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the management_rights_group object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the management_rights_group object.

name.description: (Optional) A name is optional, and by default management rights groups are anonymous. If a name is supplied when you create or update the management_rights_group, the name must be unique.

not_flag.description: (Optional) If set to <samp>true</samp>, the members of the group are all the items that would have normally been excluded.

parameters.description: (Optional) An array of parameter objects to substitute into the source group.

saved_question_id.description: The ID of the saved question that tracks computer IDs in this management_rights_group. The saved question could be created due to tracking of the user.effective_group_id property, or the persona.group_id property if the track_computer_id_flag property is set to <samp>1</samp>.

source_id.description: (Optional) The source id of the management_rights_group for parameterized groups.

sub_groups.description: (Optional) An array of child group objects. When you use the <samp>GET /api/v2/management_rights_groups</samp> path, you can apply cache_filters to this property to limit results.

text.description: (Optional) A description of the clients that this management_rights_group represents.

track_computer_id_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>1</samp> to enable the saved question that tracks the computer ID. Named groups only.

track_computer_id_interval.description: (Optional) How often to issue the saved question to track computer IDs, in seconds. Use this option when track_computer_id_flag is set to <samp>1</samp>. Default is 4 hours; minimum is 1 hour. Named groups only. If there are multiple originators (such as user or persona) for tracking, the server uses the most aggressive frequency to create or update the tracking saved question.

type.description:
(Optional) The type of the group. The group object is a parent object for other group types, including action groups, manual groups, filter groups, and management rights groups. Possible values:
ValueTypesDescription
0group
filter_group
management_rights_group		A computer group where the membership is based on the results of a sensor filter expression, such as is Windows equals true. Group objects with a type of 0 include group, filter_group, and management_rights_group.
1action_groupAn action group includes one or more computer groups for which to apply an action.
2Action policy pair groupThis group type does not have an associated object through the API.
3Ad hoc groupThis group type does not have an associated object through the API.
4computer_groupA computer group where the membership is manually defined with a list of computer names or IP addresses.

metadata_item.description: A piece of metadata that consists of a name-value pair.

admin_flag.description: If <samp>true</samp>, only Administrators or Content Set Administrators can see this object.

name.description: The name of the metadata.

options.description:
Available options that you can include as header parameters on requests to the server. Some options can be sent as query string parameters; see specific paths for usage.

Include options as only header parameters or only query string parameters in a single request. If you include options as both header parameters and query string parameters, the server might ignore the query string parameters.

allow_cdata_base64_encode_flag.description: When set to <samp>1</samp>, and there is invalid XML character in the result data, the server Base64 encodes the CDATA tag. When data is encoded, a read-only option "cdata_base64_encoded" is added as an indicator.

cache_expiration.description: The number of seconds the cache remains in memory on the server. Each request renews the specified cache. Setting cache_expiration to <samp>0</samp> expires the cache. A cache also expires if the session expires. For an example, see the <samp>GET /api/v2/computer_groups</samp> path.

cache_filters.description: An array of cache_filters that filter the results that are returned. For multiple filters, an item must pass all filters to be returned.

cache_id.description: Use cache_id in subsequent requests to use this cache for performance gains. The original request must have a non-zero value for cache_expiration. A cache also expires if the session expires. Requests that support a cache respond with the cache_info populated. For an example, see the <samp>GET /api/v2/computer_groups</samp> path.

cache_sort_fields.description: Use to sort the objects in a particular cache. Only sorting of top-level tags of objects is supported. This is a comma delimited list with a "-"" in front of the property name for reverse sort.

export_flag.description: Set to 1 to export all data to a zipped CSV file (csv.gz) in an export folder in the installation folder of the Tanium Server. For example, in a default installation on Windows, the content saves to <Tanium Server>\Program Files\Tanium\Tanium Server\export. For TanOS, the default path is /opt/Tanium/TaniumServer/export. The related <timestamp>.status and <timestamp>.qids files are created in the same directory for progress tracking and debugging. The format of a successful response to a call that uses this flag resembles {"data":"1/666718235270.csv"}. To access the resource, prepend /export/ to the response value and then append .gz to produce a value such as /export/1/666718235270.csv.gz. You can then append this relative URL to the absolute URL of the Tanium Server installation folder to retrieve the CSV file. For example, on Windows: scp "john_doe@10.20.30.40:C:/Program\ Files/Tanium/Tanium\ Server/export/1/666717564799.csv.gz" .You can also switch out the file extension to access the related <timestamp>.status and <timestamp>.qids files. Allowed values: 0,1

export_format.description:
Valid values:
  • 0 = CSV format (backward compatible with console export)
  • 1 = result xml format, similar to normal api use
  • 2 = CEF format, flattened

export_hide_csv_header_flag.description: When exporting in CSV format, omit column headers.

export_leading_text.description: When exporting, insert this text to the beginning of each line.

export_trailing_text.description: When exporting, append this text to the end of each line.

filter_not_flag.description: If set to <samp>1</samp>, the rows returned are all the rows that do not match the value in the filter_string property.

filter_string.description: Filter results to only include items that match this regular expression. This property is independent of any filters in cache_filters.

hide_errors_flag.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> when retrieving question results to suppress error messages in the API response.

hide_no_results_flag.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> when retrieving question results to suppress no result messages in the API response.

import_analyze_conflicts_only.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> if you want the import to only preview conflicts.

import_conflict_options.description: Specify how to handle import conflicts.

import_existing_ignore_content_set.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> if imported objects should stay in their current content set if they already exist.

include_hidden_flag.description: When retrieving objects, set to <samp>1</samp> to include hidden objects (objects with hidden_flag = <samp>1</samp>). Types of objects that can be hidden include actions, packages, questions, sensors, and system_settings.

include_user_details.description: Use on requests that include user information. Set to <samp>1</samp> to return the user object (for each requested user) with additional details, such as active_session_count.

include_user_owned_object_ids_flag.description: Return owned object IDs. Administrator only.

json_pretty_print.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> to add whitespace to JSON returned by the request.

most_recent_flag.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> to include the most recent results for all endpoints, including the most recent results for offline endpoints.

no_result_row_collation_flag.description: If set to <samp>1</samp>, identical result rows do not stack.  Set to <samp>1</samp> to get one row per computer with CID.

recent_result_buckets.description: A comma-separated list of integers. If empty or unspecified, the default value is "600,3600,86400,604800". When the most_recent_flag property is set to <samp>1</samp>, results that are identical other than age are grouped into age range buckets. By default, all ages less than 600 seconds are in the first ("current results") group. The second group contains all ages less than 3600 seconds, but greater than or equal to 600. The final group includes all ages greater than the last specified range. You might include any number of buckets.

return_cdata_flag.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> to return results in the ResultXML tag as raw xml wrapped in a CDATA tag instead of the result_object tag.

return_lists_flag.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> to consolidate result objects into a list tag, enabling the inclusion of "info" tag metadata.

row_count.description: Specify a row_start and row_count to select a subset of the result data.

row_start.description: Specify a row_start and row_count to select a subset of the result data.

sample_count.description: The number of samples to examine.

sample_frequency.description: The duration between samples, in seconds.

sample_start.description: The number of samples into the past to start with. For example, set to <samp>0</samp> to start with the most recent sample.

saved_question_qids_allow_multiple_flags.description: Use to find all question IDs (instead of the recent one) for a given saved question ID.

saved_question_qids_ignore_mr_group_flag.description: Administrator only. Use to find all question IDs for a given saved question ID.

saved_question_qids_reissue_flag.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> to reissue the specified saved question using the group ID specified in the context_id property.

script_data.description: Use to pass data between plugins.

sort_order.description: Specify the sort order as a comma-separated list of column indices, where the first column is column 1. A negative integer indicates descending sort order. For example, "3,-2" means sort by the third column ascending first, and break ties by sorting by the second column descending.

suppress_object_list.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> if you do not want the original object returned on add and update paths. Default value is <samp>0</samp>.

use_error_objects.description: On a failed request, show the error details for a specific object instead of just an exception message.

bytes_downloaded.description: The bytes already downloaded in the package file.

bytes_total.description: The total bytes in the package file.

cache_status.description:
The availability of the file on the server. Expected values are:
  • Cached
  • Processing
  • [ a string starting with ERROR or Error ]

direct_download_flag.description: (Optional) If set to <samp>true</samp>, clients attempt to download the file from the URL that is specified in the source property. If the attempt fails, or if direct_download_flag is set to <samp>false</samp>, clients download the file from the Tanium Server. Default value is <samp>false</samp>.

download_seconds.description: (Optional) How frequently to check the source to see if there is a new version of the file.

download_start_time.description: The date and time when the download began.

file_status.description: An array of package_file_status objects that contain a summary of the file status for each server.

hash.description: The SHA-256 hash of the contents of the file.

id.description: The unique ID of the package_file object.

last_download_progress_time.description: The most recent date and time when the download progress changed.

name.description: (Optional) The unique name of the package_file object.

source.description: (Optional) Where to get the file from, usually a URL or UNC path.

status.description:
The download status of the file. Common values are:
  • 0 - check cache_status
  • 2 - in progress
  • 4 - in progress
  • Other number less than 100 - error
  • 200 - complete (check cache_status)
  • 4XX - HTTP client error
  • 5XX - HTTP server error
  • 1xxx - other error

trigger_download.description: (Optional) When set to <samp>1</samp>, use this property with the <samp>PATCH /api/v2/package_files/{id}</samp> path to trigger a re-download of this file into the cache.

package_file_status.description: Contains the status of a file in a package.

bytes_downloaded.description: The bytes already downloaded in the package file.

bytes_total.description: The total bytes in the package file.

cache_message.description: Any description provided by the server to describe the value returned in the cache_status property. This property is commonly populated when an error occurs.

cache_status.description: The availability of the file on the server.

download_identifier.description: The unique identifier for the file to download. This property is available in Tanium Core Platform 7.4.4.1208 and later.

download_start_time.description: The date and time when the download began.

last_download_progress_time.description: The most recent time when the download progress changed.

server_id.description: The ID of the server that reported the file status.

server_name.description: The name of the server that reported the file status.

status.description:
The download status of the file. Common values are:
  • 0 - check cache_status
  • 2 - in progress
  • 4 - in progress
  • Other number less than 100 - error
  • 200 - complete (check cache_status)
  • 4XX - HTTP client error
  • 5XX - HTTP server error
  • 1xxx - other error

download_seconds.description: (Optional) The frequency to check the source to see if there is a new version of the file.

hash.description: (Optional) The SHA-256 hash of the contents of the file.

name.description: (Optional) The unique name of the package_file_template object.

source.description: (Optional) The location to retrieve the file, usually a URL or UNC path.

package_spec.description: A package_spec object defines a package. A package contains a list of files to distribute and a command to run.

available_time.description: The date and time when all of the files became available.

cache_row_id.description: The unique ID in the response cache.

command_timeout.description: (Optional) Limit on how long the command can run before it terminates.

content_set.description: (Optional) The ID of the content set to associate with the package.

creation_time.description: The date and time when this object was created in the database.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the package_spec is deleted, <samp>false</samp> if the package_spec is active.

display_name.description: (Optional) The name of the package that appears in the user interface.

exit_code_criteria.description: (Optional) The criteria object associated with this package, defining any action exit codes associated with a <samp>Succeeded</samp> error message.

expire_seconds.description: (Optional) The default expiration used for an action issued with the package. This value is used if the issuing action does not specify its own expire_seconds value.

file_templates.description: (Optional) An array of package_file_template objects to distribute, where file is determined by parameter substitution.

files.description: (Optional) An array of package_file objects to distribute.

hidden_flag.description: (Optional) If set to <samp>true</samp>, this object does not show to end users. If no source_id value is specified, the default value of this property is <samp>false</samp>. If a source_id value is specified, the default value of this property is <samp>true</samp>.

id.description: The unique ID of the package_spec object.

last_modified_by.description: Deprecated. The user who most recently modified this object. Refer to the mod_user and mod_persona properties instead.

last_update.description: The most recent date and time when this object was modified.

metadata.description: An array of metadata_item objects that describe this object.

mod_persona.description: The persona who most recently modified this object, if any. This property does not appear when the default persona is used to modify the object.

mod_user.description: The user who most recently modified this object.

modification_time.description: The most recent date and time when this object was modified.

name.description: The unique name of the package_spec object.

parameter_definition.description: (Optional) A string that contains custom parameters to send with the package.

parameters.description: (Optional) An array of parameter objects to send with the package. For each parameter you define, set <samp>key</samp> equal to <samp>$</samp> and a digit in increasing order. For example, if you define three parameters, set the key values equal to <samp>$1</samp>, <samp>$2</samp>, and <samp>$3</samp>.

process_group_flag.description: (Optional) If value is <samp>true</samp>, Tanium 7.1+ clients run the package command in a process group, and kill any remaining descendant processes when the package command completes. This setting is not used by pre-7.1 clients. Default value is <samp>false</samp>.

sensors.description: (Optional) An array of sensor objects to include in the package.

signature.description: (Optional) A value that is verified if the server license requires signed content.

skip_lock_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to enable locked clients to execute actions that include this package.

source_hash_changed_flag.description:
(Optional) Applicable only to derived packages.
For source package: the hash representation of current state of the source package, and it can change when certain properties of this package are modified.
For non-source package: the hash is copied from the source package at creation time and will not change.

source_id.description: (Optional) The ID of the package into which the parameters are substituted. For derived packages, this property contains the source_id of the source (root) package.

source_name.description: (Optional) The name of the source package. This property is used by the import and export paths when IDs change. For derived packages, this property contains the source_name of the source (root) package.

source_hash.description: (Optional) Detects whether the derived package is out of sync with the source package.

verify_expire_seconds.description: (Optional) A verification failure timeout. The clock begins with the start of the action. If the action cannot be verified by the timeout, the action status is reported as failed.

verify_group.description: (Optional) Use this to specify a verify group. A group is created if one does not exist.

parameter_text_area.description: This shows a text field that spans multiple rows in Tanium Console. Users can enter text.

defaultValue.description: The value that appears in Tanium Console by default.

heightInLines.description: The text area height in Tanium Console.

helpString.description: (Optional) The help text for the parameter that appears when you hover over the information icon in Tanium Console.

key.description: The attribute name of the parameter.

label.description: The display label of the parameter in Tanium Console.

maxChars.description: (Optional) The maximum number of characters allowed in Tanium Console.

model.description: Set to <samp>com.tanium.components.parameters::TextAreaParameter</samp> for a text area parameter.

parameterType.description: Set to <samp>com.tanium.components.parameters::TextAreaParameter</samp> for a text area parameter.

promptText.description: (Optional) The example text that appears in Tanium Console if the parameter does not contain a value.

validationExpressions.description: (Optional) An array of string values that define the JSON regular expression applied against the value submitted in Tanium Console. The value must match every regular expression to be submitted.

parameter_text_input.description: This shows a text field in Tanium Console. Users can enter text.

defaultValue.description: The value that appears in Tanium Console by default.

helpString.description: (Optional) The help text for the parameter that appears when you hover over the information icon in Tanium Console.

key.description: The attribute name of the parameter.

label.description: The display label of the parameter in Tanium Console.

maxChars.description: (Optional) The maximum number of characters allowed in Tanium Console.

model.description: Set to <samp>com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter</samp> for a text input parameter.

parameterType.description: Set to <samp>com.tanium.components.parameters::TextInputParameter</samp> for a text input parameter.

promptText.description: (Optional) The example text that appears in Tanium Console if the parameter does not contain a value.

validationExpressions.description: (Optional) An array of string values that define the JSON regular expression applied against the value submitted in Tanium Console. The value must match every regular expression to be submitted.

parameter_time.description: This shows a time selection field in Tanium Console.

componentType.description: Set to <samp>2</samp> for a time parameter.

defaultValue.description: (Optional) Set to a Unix timestamp to load that timestamp by default, or set to <samp>null</samp> to load the current time by default.

end_time_restriction.description: (Optional) An object with information about the parameter end time restriction.

helpString.description: (Optional) The help text for the parameter that appears when you hover over the information icon in Tanium Console.

key.description: The attribute name of the parameter.

label.description: The display label of the parameter in Tanium Console.

model.description: Set to <samp>com.tanium.components.parameters::DateTimeParameter</samp> for a time  parameter.

parameterType.description: Set to <samp>com.tanium.components.parameters::DateTimeParameter</samp> for a time parameter.

start_time_restriction.description: (Optional) An object with information about the parameter start time restriction.

parameter_definition.description: A string that contains custom parameter objects you can define to pass values to packages and sensors.

model.description: The parameter array model. Set this to <samp>com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray</samp>.

parameters.description: An array of parameter objects to substitute into the package or sensor. See parameters for more information.

parameterType.description: The parameter array type. Set this to <samp>com.tanium.components.parameters::ParametersArray</samp>.

parse_job.description: A parse_job object returns an array of parse_result_group objects, each of which corresponds to a possible question object that might match the question_text of the parse_job.

parser_version.description:
(Optional) Default is 0. Possible values:
  • 0 - old parser returning parse_results
  • 1 - old parser returning questions
  • 2 - new parser returning questions, with failover to old parser returning questions if new parser fails/times out
  • 3 - new parser returning questions, no failover

parameter_values.description: (Optional) Tanium Core Platform 7.2 and later strips parameters and returns them here, left to right order.

question.description: (Optional) Later versions return these instead of parse_results.

question_group_sensors.description: (Optional) An array of sensor objects. Later versions include this extra data to help with parameterization.

sensor_references.description: (Optional) Deprecated. Tanium Core Platform 7.3 and later returns sensor names and start char in the question text.

persona.description: A persona is a set of roles and computer groups that a user selects for a Tanium session. Use the <samp>POST /api/v2/personas</samp> path to create a persona and assign it to users and user groups. The default persona includes all the permissions for roles and computer groups that the user inherits from user groups. An alternative persona excludes all permissions inherited from user groups or assigned to other personas. Assigning multiple personas to a user account enables you to enforce different sets of restrictions on what the user can see and do with the Tanium Platform, based on the work scope for a given session, without having to configure multiple accounts for that user.

content_set_role_list.description: (Optional) An array of content_set_role objects that apply to the persona.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the persona object.

created_time.description: The UTC time and date when the persona object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created the persona object.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the persona is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the persona is active.

display_name.description: (Optional) The name of the persona that appears in the user interface.

group.description: (Optional) A group to assign to the persona. If omitted, the group is set to the <samp>No Computers</samp> group.

id.description: The unique ID of the persona object.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the persona object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the persona object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the persona object.

name.description: The name of the persona.

require_reauthentication_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to require a user that switches to this persona to reauthenticate before continuing.

track_computer_id_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to enable tracking the computer ID for the group ID of the persona. If the group rights of the persona change, the server recreates or updates the tracking saved question accordingly.

track_computer_id_interval_seconds.description: (Optional) Use when track_computer_id_flag is <samp>1</samp>. Default is 4 hours; minimum is 1 hour (3600 seconds). If this value is not set, the track_computer_id_flag property is ignored.

user_group_list.description: (Optional) An array of user_group objects to which the persona applies.

user_list.description: (Optional) An array of user objects assigned to the persona.

persona_no_recursive_links.description: A persona is a set of roles and computer groups that a user selects for a Tanium session. Use the <samp>POST /api/v2/personas</samp> path to create a persona and assign it to users and user groups. The default persona includes all the permissions for roles and computer groups that the user inherits from user groups. An alternative persona excludes all permissions inherited from user groups or assigned to other personas. Assigning multiple personas to a user account enables you to enforce different sets of restrictions on what the user can see and do with the Tanium Platform, based on the work scope for a given session, without having to configure multiple accounts for that user.

content_set_role_list.description: (Optional) An array of content_set_role objects that apply to the persona.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the persona object.

created_time.description: The UTC time and date when the persona object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created the persona object.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the persona is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the persona is active.

display_name.description: (Optional) The name of the persona that appears in the user interface.

group.description: (Optional) A group to assign to the persona. If omitted, the group is set to the <samp>No Computers</samp> group.

id.description: The unique ID of the persona object.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the persona object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the persona object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the persona object.

name.description: The name of the persona.

require_reauthentication_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to require a user that switches to this persona to reauthenticate before continuing.

track_computer_id_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to enable tracking the computer ID for the group ID of the persona. If the group rights of the persona change, the server recreates or updates the tracking saved question accordingly.

track_computer_id_interval_seconds.description: (Optional) Use when track_computer_id_flag is <samp>1</samp>. Default is 4 hours; minimum is 1 hour (3600 seconds). If this value is not set, the track_computer_id_flag property is ignored.

user_group_list.description: (Optional) An array of user_group objects to which the persona applies.

user_list.description: (Optional) An array of user objects assigned to the persona.

hsm_allow_uninitialized_token.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the HSM allows uninitialized tokens.

hsm_pin.description: The token PIN, this property is empty when getting an object.

hsm_token_id.description: The ID of the token to use if hsm_token_name is empty.

hsm_token_name.description: The name of the token to use. If neither the hsm_token_name or hsm_token_id are specified, the first token in the HSM is used.

id.description: The unique ID of the pki_key_configuration object.

key_role.description: The type of key to configure.

key_role_name.description: The name of the key to configure (such as Root or Message Signing).

use_hsm_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the pki_key_configuration uses HSM, <samp>false</samp> otherwise.

pki_root_key.description: A key that governs the security of non-Tanium communication among the endpoints in an enterprise, regardless of whether the Tanium Client is installed on them. Keys are not shared between servers in a redundant cluster configuration.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the pki_root_key object.

created_time.description: The date and time when the pki_root_key object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created the pki_root_key object.

fingerprint.description: The unique fingerprint of the pki_root_key object.

fingerprint_algorithm.description: The cryptographic hash algorithm of the fingerprint.

hsm_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the pki_root_key uses HSM, <samp>false</samp> otherwise.

id.description: The unique ID of the pki_root_key object.

legacy_314_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the key is the 314 protocol version.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the pki_root_key object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the pki_root_key object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the pki_root_key object.

name.description: The name of the pki_root_key object.

not_after.description: The date after which the key is not usable.

not_before.description: The date before which the key is not usable.

revoked_by_persona.description: The persona that was used by the revoked_by_user to revoke the pki_root_key object.

revoked_by_user.description: The user who revoked the pki_root_key object.

revoked_time.description: The date and time when the pki_root_key object was revoked.

short_fingerprint.description: A short sequence to identify the longer public key.

type.description: The type of key (RSA or EC).

plugin.description: A plugin is an extension to a Tanium core platform component or solution module.

arguments.description: (Optional) An array of plugin_argument objects. If this is an SQL plugin, this list contains arguments supplied to the query.

bundle.description: (Optional) The bundle that contains this plugin.

cache_row_id.description: (Optional) The unique ID in the response cache.

commands.description: (Optional) An array of strings that contain the commands run by the plugin.

content_set.description: (Optional) The ID of the content_set to associate with the plugin.

execution_id.description: (Optional) If this is a detached plugin request, this property contains the ID used to look up the results. If this is supplied in a GET request, the status is returned.

exit_code.description: (Optional) If the plugin is a script type, this property contains the exit code.

filename.description: (Optional) The file that contains the plugin.

forbid_concurrent_execution.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>0</samp> to allow multiple instances of the plugin to run. Set to <samp>1</samp> to allow only one instance of the plugin to run at a time.

input.description: (Optional) If the plugin is a script, this property contains the value passed to the stdin of the script.

kill_process_tree_flag.description: (Optional) If a process runs for the plugin, set to <samp>0</samp> to run the process in a process group. Set to <samp>1</samp> to run the process outside a process group. Default value is <samp>0</samp>.

metadata.description: (Optional) An array of metadata_item objects that describe this object.

name.description: (Optional) The unique name of the plugin.

path.description: (Optional) The path where the commands run and where the configuration file resides.

permissions.description: (Optional) An array of strings that define the permissions required to use this plugin.

plugin_server.description: (Optional) If multiple plugin servers exist, use this property to specify the server to run the plugin.

plugin_url.description: (Optional) If this is a remote plugin, this property specifies the URI to access the plugin. For example: <samp>/plugin/foo/bar</samp>

run_detached_flag.description: (Optional) This plugin execution request responds immediately when the plugin runs in the background.

script_response.description: (Optional) If the plugin is a script type, this property contains the response object.

sql.description: (Optional) If the plugin is an SQL type, this property contains an array of SQL arguments.

status.description: The status of the plugin execution.

status_file_content.description: (Optional) The contents of the status file, if supplied in the run request. The status file location is stored in the environment variable PLUGIN_STATUS_FILE. Any plugins that want content here should populate that file.

timeout_seconds.description: (Optional) The maximum run-time of a plugin, in seconds. Default is 10 seconds.

type.description: (Optional) The plugin type, either SQL or script. Return data only.

plugin_argument.description: A name-value pair argument to include with the plugin.

name.description: The name of the argument.

type.description: (Optional) The type of the argument.

plugin_schedule.description: When you create a plugin schedule, the Tanium Server runs the specified plugin based on the configuration. Each execution runs as the user that created the schedule.

arguments.description: (Optional) An array of plugin_argument objects. For an SQL plugin, this list contains the arguments supplied to the query.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the plugin_schedule is deleted, <samp>false</samp> if the plugin_schedule is active.

enabled.description: (Optional) Value is <samp>true</samp> if the schedule is enabled, <samp>false</samp> if the schedule is disabled.

end_date.description: (Optional) If supplied, the schedule only runs until the specified date.

end_hour.description: (Optional) If supplied, the schedule only runs until the specified hour on each day.

id.description: The unique ID of the plugin_schedule object.

input.description: (Optional) For script plugins, contains the value passed to the stdin of the script.

last_exit_code.description: The exit code of last run.

last_run_text.description: If the plugin is not SQL, contains the output.

last_run_time.description: The most recent time when the plugin ran.

modification_time.description: (Optional) The most recent date and time when this object was modified.

mod_user.description: The user who most recently modified this object.

name.description: (Optional) The unique name of this schedule.

persona.description: The ID of the persona that was used to create the plugin_schedule. This property does not appear when the default persona is used to create the object. If this persona is deleted, the Tanium Server no longer reissues the plugin schedule.

plugin_bundle.description: (Optional) The bundle to include the plugin.

plugin_name.description: (Optional) The name of the plugin to run.

plugin_server.description: (Optional) The server that contains the plugin.

run_on_days.description: (Optional) If supplied, plugin only runs on the specified days. Values must be separated by commas. For example: <samp>Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun</samp>.

start_date.description: (Optional) If supplied, the schedule only runs after the specified date.

start_hour.description: (Optional) If supplied, the schedule only runs between the values specified in the start_hour and end_hour properties.

user.description: The plugin runs under this username. If this user is deleted, the Tanium Server no longer reissues the plugin schedule.

example.name: Trends Service

plugin_sql.description: The results for an SQL plugin.

columns.description: (Optional) An array of strings that contains the names of the columns in the SQL database.

result_count.description: (Optional) The number of results from the SQL query.

result_row.description: (Optional) An array of rows returned by the SQL query.

question.description: The definition for a Tanium question. Use a question to obtain key pieces of information from managed enterprise endpoints. A question object contains a list of data to retrieve (the "selects"), plus a group that defines the set of machines from which to retrieve the data.

action_tracking_flag.description: (Optional) A value of <samp>true</samp> indicates this question is intended to track action status history. If this question object is an instance of a saved question, this property is derived from the saved question.

context_group.description: (Optional) The context in which the question is asked, similar to management_rights_group but not tied to the user/session context. Use this property to narrow the group of machines from which to retrieve data.

expiration.description: The date and time when the question expires.

expire_seconds.description: (Optional) The number of seconds before the question expires. Default is 600.

force_computer_id_flag.description: (Optional) If the value is <samp>true</samp>, force the question to not be a counting question if only one select is present. If this question object is an instance of a saved question, this property is derived from the saved question.

from_canonical_text.description: (Optional) Only included on output of question parser results, and the value is <samp>1</samp> if the question text was canonically (unambiguously) understood.

group.description: (Optional) The group of machines from which to retrieve the data.

hidden_flag.description: (Optional) If the value is <samp>true</samp>, this object is not visible to end users. If this question object is an instance of a saved question, this property is derived from the saved question.

id.description: The unique ID of the question object.

index.description: (Optional) Specifies the order in which questions/saved_questions are merged when using the GetMergedResultData command. All or none of the questions/saved_questions in the object_list must specify an index, and if the index values are specified, they must be contiguous and begin with 0 and not include any duplicate values.

is_expired.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the question expired, value is <samp>false</samp> if the question is active.

persona.description: The persona that was used by the user to create (issue) the question.

priority.description:
(Optional) Set to 1 for questions asked by a user whom is actively viewing responses, such as through Tanium Interact. Set to 0 for normal priority questions, such as questions whose responses are not actively viewed at the time. Set to -1 for lower priority questions, such as background tasks loading data into external systems. Default is 0.

Note: Do not set this value to 1 unless absolutely necessary. Setting too many questions to a priority of 1 negatively impacts system performance by deprioritizing core system tasks.

Note: Questions with a value of -1 eventually process. These lower priority questions are never discarded based on the priority of other questions.

management_rights_group.description: The management rights group of the user at the time the question was issued.

name.description: (Optional) The name for the question. If this question object is an instance of a saved question, this property is derived from the saved question.

query_text.description: (Optional) The textual representation of the question. If this question object is an instance of a saved question, this property is derived from the saved question.

saved_question.description: (Optional) The saved question, if any, associated to question.

selects.description: (Optional) An array of select objects that define the list of data to retrieve.

skip_lock_flag.description: (Optional) If the value is <samp>true</samp>, clients ignore the value of the skip_lock client setting.

user.description: The user who created (issued) this question. The question is only answered by machines that were members of the management rights group of the user when the question was issued.

group.text: ( all Is Virtual contains Yes and Is Windows contains True )

example.query_text: Get Tanium Client Explicit Setting[LogVerbosityLevel] from all machines with ( all Is Virtual contains Yes and Is Windows contains True )

question_history.description: A question_history object contains the history of issued question objects.
An array of question objects that have been issued.

question_history.name: Operating System
question_history.query_text: Get?forceComputerIdFlag=1 Operating System from all machines

question_history.name: Tanium Client Core Health
question_history.query_text: Get Tanium Client Core Health from all machines with Tanium Client Core Health matches "Error:.*"

ResultXML.description:
Contains the server response for the following paths:
  • GET /api/v2/result_data/action/{id}
  • GET /api/v2/result_info/action/{id}
  • GET /api/v2/result_data/question/{id}
  • GET /api/v2/result_info/question/{id}
  • GET /api/v2/result_data/saved_question/{id}
  • GET /api/v2/result_info/saved_question/{id}
  • GET /api/v2/merged_result_data/{object}/{id}/{object}/{id}

cache_id.description: The ID of the cache created by the request.

cid.description: The computer ID, or <samp>0</samp> if no computer ID exists.

columns.description: An array that contains descriptions of the results returned. Use columns with the values in the rows property to build a table.

archived_question_id.description: The ID of the archived_question object, if any.

error_count.description: The number of errors reported by endpoints. Note that one endpoint can report multiple errors.

estimated_total.description: The total number of registered endpoints at the time when the question was issued.

expiration.description: The time that the cached results expire.

expire_seconds.description: The duration, in seconds, until the question expires.

filtered_row_count.description: The number of result rows after applying a filter.

filtered_row_count_machines.description: The total number of endpoints that contributed to the result rows, after applying a filter.

id.description: The ID of the question object or saved_question object.

issue_seconds.description: The number of seconds since the question was issued.

item_count.description: The number of different answers returned, after filters (same as filtered_row_count).

mr_passed.description:
The number of endpoints that are within the computer management groups of the persona who submitted the question. The value of the mr_passed property represents a subset of the endpoints in the mr_tested property.

The Tanium Server evaluates the endpoints in the mr_passed property to determine which endpoints are contained in any filter groups specified in the question; see the description for the tested property.

For more information on computer management groups, see Tanium Console User Guide: Managing computer groups.

mr_tested.description:
The total number of endpoints that the Tanium Server targets to evaluate the question. This number represents all endpoints that are currently online. Note that mr_tested does not include endpoints that are online but that have a sensor problem that prevents the endpoints from evaluating the filters specified in the question.

To determine if the results are complete, compare the mr_tested value with the estimated_total value. When the values match, or when the percentage of mr_tested divided by estimated_total meets the criteria of the default_percent_when_complete global setting, the results are complete.

The Tanium Server evaluates the endpoints reported in mr_tested to determine which endpoints are within the computer management groups of the persona who submitted the question; see the description for the mr_passed property.

no_results_count.description: The number of endpoints that reported with no results. Note than an endpoint can report multiple times with a report, error, or no result.

now.description: The date and time when these results were retrieved.

passed.description:
The number of endpoints that match any of the computer filter groups specified in the question. Computer filter groups are contained as a predicate of the question, starting with the word with. For example, if you ask the question Get Computer Name from all machines with Is Windows equals True, the predicate to evaluate is with Is Windows equals True.

The value of the passed property represents a subset of the endpoints reported in the tested property. Endpoints reported in the passed property have passed both the management rights group evaluation and the filter group evaluation (the evaluation order is mr_tested > mr_passed > tested > passed); endpoints reported in the passed property return results for the question.

For more information on computer filter groups, see Tanium Console User Guide: Managing computer groups.

question_id.description: The ID of the question object.

report_count.description: The number of endpoints that responded to the question.

row_count.description: The number of different answers returned. For example, the question <samp>Get Online from all machines</samp> could return a report_count of 100,000 and a row_count of 2 (true and false).

row_count_machines.description: The total number of endpoints that contributed to the result rows.

rows.description: An array that contains the results returned, if any. Data is arranged by the values in the columns property.

saved_question_id.description: The ID of the saved_question object, if any.

seconds_since_issued.description: The duration, in seconds, since the question was issued.

select_count.description: The number of sensors selected by the question.

tested.description:
The number of endpoints that the Tanium Server evaluates to determine if they are contained in any of the computer filter groups specified in the predicate of the question. The predicate includes the clause that starts with the word with. For example, if you ask the question "Get Computer Name from all machines with Is Windows equals True", the predicate is with Is Windows equals True.

The value of the tested property normally contains all endpoints reported in the mr_passed property.

Endpoints that match a computer filter group are reported in the passed property; see the description of the passed property for more information.

Note: The evaluation between the tested and passed properties does not include computer filter groups on the left side of the question. For example, if you ask the question "Get Computer Name and PowerShell Version equals 2.0 from all machines with Country Code equals 44", the filter with Is Windows equals True is evaluated, but the PowerShell Version equals 2.0 filter is not evaluated. The Tanium Server evaluates the sensor for PowerShell Version equals 2.0 only after the endpoint passes all checks, processes the sensors for the question, and then returns results.

For more information on computer filter groups, see Tanium Console User Guide: Managing computer groups.

saved_action.description: A scheduled action that can be reissued multiple times.

action_group.description: An action group to further limit the results. When the action is issued, this property is combined (AND) with the group specified in the target_group property.

approved_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the saved action is approved, <samp>false</samp> if not approved.

approver.description: The user to approve the saved action.

approver_persona.description: The name and ID of the persona to approve the saved_action, if any. If there is no persona, this property is omitted.

cache_row_id.description: The unique ID in the response cache.

creation_time.description: The date and time when this object was created in the database.

distribute_seconds.description: (Optional) The number of seconds over which to deploy the action.

end_time.description: (Optional) The date and time to stop issuing actions. Omit to specify no end time. This value can be updated after the saved_action is created, but not when the saved_action is running. To change a saved_action to no end time, set to <samp>2001-01-01T00:00:00</samp> (epoch time).

expire_seconds.description:
The duration from the start time of the action being issued before the action expires. If no value is specified, the action uses the expire_seconds value of the package_spec object. If neither the action nor the package_spec specify this property, the action expires immediately. If the action.package_spec.process_group_flag property is 1, the package command runs in a process group, and the Tanium Client terminates all processes in the group when the action expires. If the action.package_spec.process_group_flag property is 0, processes are not automatically terminated. The package author should make sure that the process exits in this case.

For the best results, calculate an expire_seconds value by adding the saved_action.package_spec.package_file.download_seconds, saved_action.package_spec.command_timeout, and saved_action.distribute_seconds values.

id.description: (Optional) The unique ID of the saved_action object.

issue_count.description: The number of times the scheduled action issued an action.

issue_seconds.description: (Optional) How often to reissue an action from the saved action.

last_action.description: (Optional) The action object that was issued last.

last_start_time.description: The most recent date and time that the action started.

metadata.description: (Optional) An array of metadata_item objects that describe this object.

mod_persona.description: The persona who most recently modified this object, if any. This property does not appear when the default persona is used to modify the object.

mod_user.description: The user who most recently modified this object.

name.description:
(Optional) The name of the saved_action object.

For the best results, define unique saved_action.name values.

next_start_time.description: The next date and time when the action will start.

package_spec.description: The package deployed by the saved action.

persona.description: The IS of the persona that was used to create the saved_action. This property does not appear when the default persona is used to modify the object. If this persona is deleted, the Tanium Server no longer reissues the saved action.

policy.description: (Optional) The policy configuration of the saved action.

policy_flag.description: (Optional) Value is <samp>false</samp> if the policy is not in use, value is <samp>true</samp> if the policy is in use.

priority.description:
(Optional) Set to 1 for actions deployed by a user whom is actively working, such as through Tanium Direct Connect or Tanium Screen Sharing. Set to 0 for normal priority actions, such as deployed actions for which a user is not actively waiting on the result. Set to -1 for lower priority actions, such as background tasks for lower priority maintenance. Default is 0.

Note: Do not set this value to 1 unless absolutely necessary. Setting too many actions to a priority of 1 negatively impacts system performance by deprioritizing core system tasks.

Note: Actions with a value of -1 eventually process. These lower priority actions are never discarded based on the priority of other actions.

row_ids.description: (Optional) An array of row IDs, if any.

start_now_flag.description: (Optional) Value is <samp>false</samp> if the saved_action is not active, value is <samp>true</samp> if active.

start_time.description: (Optional) The date and time when the action became active. An empty string or null starts immediately.

status.description:
(Optional) The status of the saved action. Possible values include:
  • 0 for Enabled
  • 1 for Disabled
  • 2 for Deleted

target_group.description: (Optional) The group of machines to target. When the action is issued, this property is combined (AND) with the group specified in the action_group property. When you <samp>POST /api/v2/saved_actions</samp>, you can either define this property by the id property of an existing filter_group, or by the text property of a question to target endpoints.

user.description: The user who created the saved action. If this user is deleted, the Tanium Server no longer reissues the saved action.
