saved_action_approval.description: Create a saved_action_approval object when you want to approve a saved action. Saved action approvals are only required when the require_action_approval global setting is set to <samp>1</samp>.

approved_flag.description: (Optional) Value is <samp>true</samp> if the saved action is approved, value is <samp>false</samp> if the saved action is not approved. This uses the posting user to supply the approver name and ID.

id.description: (Optional) The ID of the saved action to be approved.

metadata.description: An array of metadata_item objects that describe this object.

name.description: (Optional) The name of the saved action to be approved. This property is not needed if the ID is supplied.

owner_user_id.description: The ID of the user that created the saved action.

saved_action_policy.description: The policy that applies to the parent saved_action object.

max_age.description: (Optional) The maximum age of the saved action. Default is the issue_seconds property of the saved_action object.

min_count.description: (Optional) The number of matching machines required to issue the saved_action. Defaults to the global setting policy_default_min_count.

saved_question_group.description: (Optional) The group of saved questions that this policy affects.

saved_question_group_id.description: (Optional) Deprecated. Use the saved_question_group property instead.

saved_question_id.description: (Optional) The ID of the saved_question that this policy affects.

saved_question.description: Use a saved_question to issue a question at a later time.

action_tracking_flag.description: (Optional) If value is <samp>true</samp>, indicates this question is intended to track action status history.

archive_enabled_flag.description: (Optional) If value is <samp>true</samp>, question is reissued according to value set in the keep_seconds property.

archive_owner.description: (Optional) The user that owns the archive. Archives can be shared between users with identical management rights groups.

cache_row_id.description: (Optional) The unique ID in the response cache.

content_set.description: (Optional) The ID of the content_set to associate with the saved question.

disabled_flag.description: (Optional) Used only when importing a saved_question object. Set to <samp>1</samp> to prevent the Tanium Server from automatically reissuing the saved question. Set to <samp>0</samp> to allow the Tanium Server to automatically reissue the saved question. If undefined on import, this property defaults to <samp>0</samp>.

expire_seconds.description: (Optional) The duration before each issuance of the question expires, in seconds. Default value is <samp>600</samp>.

hidden_flag.description: (Optional) If value is <samp>true</samp>, this is an internal object that does not appear to end users.

id.description: The unique id of the saved_question object.

index.description: (Optional) Specifies the order in which questions and saved_questions are merged when using the <samp>GET /api/v2/merged_result_data/{object}/{id}/{object}/{id}</samp> path. All or none of the questions and saved_questions in the list must specify an index. If the index values are specified, they must be contiguous, begin with 0, and not include any duplicate values.

issue_seconds_never_flag.description: (Optional) If value is <samp>true</samp>, this question is not reissued automatically.

keep_seconds.description:
(Optional) (saved per user account and persona) How often to reissue the question when active, in seconds. This property is ignored unless the archive_enabled_flag property is set to 1.

Note: Each user account and active persona combination can save a different keep_seconds value for a saved_question object. If you export or import a saved_question object, this value is set to the keep_seconds value associated with your user account and active persona, regardless of the value on the saved question when exported or in the import file when imported.

metadata.description: (Optional) An array of metadata_item objects that describe this object.

mod_persona.description: The persona who most recently modified this object, if any. This property does not appear when the default persona is used to modify the object.

mod_time.description: The most recent date and time when this object was modified.

mod_user.description: The user who most recently modified this object.

most_recent_question_id.description: (Optional) The ID of the most recently issued question object generated by this saved_question.

name.description: The name of the saved_question object. You can refer to the saved_question object by name, but if the name is not unique, an error might occur.

packages.description: (Optional) An array of package_spec objects that define the packages associated with this saved question and available to be deployed.

persona.description: (Optional) The persona used to create this object, if any. This property does not appear if the default persona was used to create the object. If this persona is deleted, the Tanium Server no longer reissues the saved question.

public_flag.description: (Optional) If the value is <samp>false</samp>, only the user that owns this object can see the object.

query_text.description: (Optional) The textual representation of the question.

question.description: The question from which to create the saved question.

row_count_flag.description: (Optional) If the value is <samp>true</samp>, only the row count data is saved when archiving this question.

seeding_question_ids.description:
(Optional) For creation only. If set, the server populates the initial result data from the specified questions. Use this property to copy recent data from one saved question, or from multiple questions, to this saved question to create the recent data set. Seeding questions must have the following:
  • The same group right as the definition question
  • The force_computer_id_flag property = 1, same for the definition question
  • At least one overlapping column with the definition question

You must trigger reissue right after creating the saved question for this to work.

skip_schedule_on_update_flag.description: (Optional) Indicates whether to create or update existing reissue schedule when updating the saved_question object.

sort_column.description: (Optional) The column to use as the default sort column if no sort_order is specified.

user.description: (Optional) The user who owns this object. If this user is deleted, the Tanium Server no longer reissues the saved question.

saved_question_package_specs.description: A list of packages associated with a saved question.

saved_question.description: (Optional) The saved question to associate the packages.

saved_question_question.description:
A list of questions associated with a saved question. Use these tanium-options to reissue or filter:
  • context_id
  • saved_question_qids_reissue_flag
  • saved_question_qids_allow_multiple_flag
  • saved_question_qids_include_expired_flag
  • saved_question_qids_ignore_mr_group_flag

saved_question.description: (Optional) The ID of the saved_question object.

scim_server.description:
A System for Cross-Domain Identity Management (SCIM) object, used by a SCIM server with the associated api_token object to communicate with the Tanium Server.

Certain scim_server.api_token properties automatically populate based on the defined scim_server property values:
PropertyPopulated value
scim_server.api_token.expire_in_daysscim_server.expire_in_days
scim_server.api_token.notesscim_server.name
scim_server.api_token.user_namescim_server.name SCIM User
scim_server.api_token.trusted_ip_addressesscim_server.trusted_ip_addresses

api_token.description: The api_token object associated with the SCIM server, used to communicate with the Tanium Server.

expire_in_days.description: (Optional) The number of days before the API token expires. You can set this value when you create the scim_server object to ignore the default expiration set by the api_token_expiration_in_days global setting. If this property is not set and the api_token_expiration_in_days global setting does not exist, the token expires after 365 days.

id.description: The unique ID of the scim_server object.

name.description: The unique name of the object.

trusted_ip_addresses.description: (Optional) A comma-separated list of IP addresses and CIDR addresses that can use the token specified in the api_token property. Note the api_token also allows connections from addresses specified in the api_token_trusted_ip_address_list global setting.

select.description: Select objects can be filtered by a simple filter. Items are checked to see if they pass all of the filters (if the and_flag is set), or any of the filters (if the and_flag is not set). If no filters are specified, all items are included.

filter.description: (Optional) Only retrieve values that pass this filter.

sensor.description: (Optional) The sensor whose values are retrieved.
A sensor is a script that runs on a client. Sensors are defined by the sensor object that includes settings, script content, and script parameters.

cache_row_id.description: (Optional) The unique ID in the response cache.

category.description: (Optional) The category that includes this sensor.

content_set.description: (Optional) The ID of the content_set to associate with the sensor.

creation_time.description: (Optional) The date and time when this object was created in the database.

delimiter.description: (Optional) One or more characters used to split the result into subcolumns.

exclude_from_parse_flag.description: (Optional) If the value is <samp>true</samp>, the string results of this sensor are not used by the natural language parser.

hash.description: (Optional) The unique hash of the sensor.

hash_size.description: (Optional) The sensor hash size in bytes.

hidden_flag.description: (Optional) If the value is <samp>true</samp>, this is an internal object that is not shown to end users.

id.description: The unique ID of the sensor object.

ignore_case_flag.description: (Optional) Default is <samp>true</samp>, which means case is ignored by default.

keep_duplicates_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to have clients preserve duplicate values in sensor results instead of only returning each unique value once.

last_modified_by.description: (Optional) The name of the user who last modified this object.

max_age_seconds.description: (Optional) How old a sensor result can be before it is invalid. When results are half this value, the sensor is re-evaluated.

max_string_age_minutes.description: (Optional) Purge result strings with values higher (older) than the last_used_minute value for the string. Set to <samp>0</samp> (the default) to disable.

max_strings.description: (Optional) The maximum number of result strings to store for the sensor. When the number of strings exceeds this value, the server purges the oldest strings. Set to <samp>0</samp> (the default) to disable.

metadata.description: (Optional) An array of metadata_item objects that describe this object.

mod_persona.description: The persona who most recently modified this object, if any. This property does not appear when the default persona is used to modify the object.

mod_user.description: The user who most recently modified this object.

modification_time.description: The most recent date and time when this object was modified.

name.description: The unique name of the sensor. Note that you cannot add <samp>linux:</samp> to a sensor name because it is reserved for system use.

parameter_definitions.description: (Optional) A string that contains custom parameters for the sensor.

parameters.description: (Optional) An array of parameter objects to substitute into the source sensor.

preview_sensor_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>1</samp> to create or acquire a preview sensor.

sensitive_data_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to provide extra security. Using this property impacts the performance of retrieving results.

source_hash.description: (Optional) The hash of the sensor into which the parameters are substituted. If specified, the source_id property might be omitted.

source_id.description: (Optional) The ID of the sensor into which the parameters are substituted. If specified, the source_hash property might be omitted.

source_name.description: (Optional) The name of the source sensor. This property is used by the import and export paths when IDs change.

string_hints.description: (Optional) An array of initial strings to be hashed and added to the string cache for this sensor.

value_type.description:
(Optional) Specifies how the values are compared.
  • String: standard lexicographical comparison (the default)
  • Version: values are expected to be version strings, such as 9.4.2 is less than 10.1.3
  • Numeric: numeric comparison, including decimal, floating point, and scientific notation
  • BESDate: values are expected to be valid BES date strings
  • IPAddress: values are expected to be IP addresses
  • WMIDate: values are expected to be valid WMI date strings
  • TimeDiff: values are expected to be an expression of an amount of time, such as "2 years, 3 months, 18 days, 4 hours, 22 minutes, and 3.67 seconds" or "4.2 hours" (numeric + "Y|MO|W|D|H|M|S" units)
  • DataSize: values are expected to be an expression of an amount of data, such as 125MB or 23K or 34.2Gig (numeric + B|K|M|G|T units)
  • NumericInteger: values are expected to be integer numeric values

example.description:
The date and time on which the currently installed Tanium Client was installed on each client machine.
Example: Wed, 13 Nov 2013 08:18:00 -0480
example.name: Tanium Client Installation Time

sensor_query.description: A script to run on a client.

platform.description: (Optional) The platform to run the script. Default value is <samp>Windows</samp>.

script.description: (Optional) The script to run on the client.

script_type.description:
(Optional) Specifies how the script runs.
  • WMIQuery: run the script as a WMI Query
  • BESRelevance: run the script as a BigFix Relevance expression (using QNA)
  • VBScript: run the script as a VB Script (if platform is Windows then this is the default)
  • Powershell: run the script using PowerShell
  • JScript: run the script using JScript (Windows platform only). Enable UI support with global setting enable_python_jscript_type_flag.
  • Python: run the script using Python. This script is available on all platforms but requires separate dll/.so files to distribute to the endpoints. Enable UI support with the global setting enable_python_jscript_type_flag.
  • UnixShell: run the script as a shell script. Use #! notation to specify a specific shell program, otherwise /bin/sh is used (if platform is Linux, Solaris, AIX, or Mac, this is the default).

signature.description: (Optional) A value to verify if the server license requires signed content.

name.description: Optional

count.description: The number of times the sensor has run across all clients.

id.description: The unique ID of the sensor.

name.description: The name of the sensor.

other_bytes_avg.description: The average number of other bytes written on each Windows client. Other bytes are defined by the QueryInformationJobObject function.

other_bytes_std.description: The standard deviation of other bytes written across all Windows clients.

read_bytes_avg.description: The average number of bytes read across all clients.

read_bytes_std.description: The standard deviation of bytes read across all clients.

real_ms_avg.description: The average amount of time, in milliseconds, that the sensor used across all clients.

real_ms_max.description: The highest amount of time, in milliseconds, that the sensor used on an individual client.

real_ms_min.description: The lowest amount of time, in milliseconds, that the sensor used on an individual client.

real_ms_std.description: The standard deviation of amount of time, in milliseconds, that the sensor used across all clients.

sys_ms_avg.description: The average number of milliseconds of system time used across all clients.

sys_ms_std.description: The standard deviation of milliseconds of system time used across all clients.

user_ms_avg.description: The average number of milliseconds of user time used across all clients.

user_ms_std.description: The standard deviation of milliseconds of user time used across all clients.

what_hash.description: The unique hash of the sensor.

write_bytes_avg.description: The average number of bytes written across all clients.

write_bytes_std.description: The standard deviation of bytes written across all clients.

sensor_subcolumn.description: A result returned by a sensor. Used by multicolumn sensors that return multiple results.

exclude_from_parse_flag.description: (Optional) If the value is <samp>true</samp>, the string results of this subcolumn will not be matched by the natural language parser.

hidden_flag.description: (Optional) If the value is <samp>true</samp>, this is an internal object that should not be shown to end users.

ignore_case_flag.description: (Optional) Ignore case if the value is <samp>true</samp>. Unlike most flags, this property defaults to <samp>true</samp>.

index.description: (Optional) The index of the delimited sensor data represented by this column.

name.description: (Optional) The name of the sensor subcolumn.

value_type.description:
(Optional) Specifies how the values are compared.
  • String: standard lexicographical comparison (the default)
  • Version: values are version strings, such as 9.4.2 is less than 10.1.3
  • Numeric: numeric comparison, including decimal, floating point, and scientific notation
  • BESDate: values are valid BES date strings
  • IPAddress: values are IP addresses
  • WMIDate: values are valid WMI date strings
  • TimeDiff: values are an expression of an amount of time, such as "2 years, 3 months, 18 days, 4 hours, 22 minutes, and 3.67 seconds" or "4.2 hours" (numeric + "Y|MO|W|D|H|M|S" units)
  • DataSize: values are an expression of an amount of data, such as 125MB or 23K or 34.2Gig (numeric + B|K|M|G|T units)
  • NumericInteger: values are integer numeric values

separated_subnet.description: A separated subnet on the Tanium Server. Tanium Clients in a separated subnet can peer only with other clients that are within that subnet. For information about separated subnets, or to configure a separated subnet for a Tanium Zone Server, see Tanium Console User Guide: Configuring Tanium Client subnets.

cidr_string.description: The subnet to isolate, in CIDR format.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the separated_subnet object.

created_time.description: The date and time when the separated_subnet object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created the separated_subnet object.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the separated_subnet is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the separated_subnet is active.

id.description: The unique ID of the separated_subnet object.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the separated_subnet object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the separated_subnet object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the separated_subnet object.

name.description: (Optional) A name that you can use to identify the separated_subnet object.

address.description: The IP address of the server.

current.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the server is the current Tanium Server (the server from which you called the API), <samp>false</samp> otherwise.

guid.description: The globally unique identifier of the server.

heart_beat.description: The timestamp when the server last reported.

id.description: The unique ID of the server object.

name.description: The name of the server.

server_host.description: Host information for the Tanium Servers in the environment. This object is returned by the <samp>GET /api/v2/server_host</samp> path.

heart_beat_age_in_minute.description: The maximum age of data returned, in minutes. The default is <samp>0</samp>, which means there is no maximum age (all results returned).

server_registration_request.description:
When a server attempts to register with the Tanium Server, a server_registration_request is automatically created.
  • Use the GET /api/v2/server_registration_requests path to retrieve a list of all server registration requests on the server.
  • Use the PATCH /api/v2/server_registration_requests/{id} path to approve, reject, or revoke server registration requests.

approved_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the server_registration_request is approved, <samp>false</samp> otherwise.

fingerprint.description: The unique fingerprint of the public key.

fqdn.description: The FQDN of the registering server.

id.description: The unique ID of the server_registration_request object.

last_claimed_by.description: When non-zero, this property contains the ID of the request from the hub that last claimed the request.

last_registered_time.description: The date and time when the registering server last registered with the Tanium Server.

local_address.description: The IP address as seen by the Tanium Server.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the server_registration_request object was last modified.

rejected_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the server_registration_request is rejected, <samp>false</samp> otherwise.

revoked_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the server_registration_request is revoked, <samp>false</samp> otherwise.

server_guid.description: The GUID of the registering server.

short_fingerprint.description: A short sequence to identify the longer public key.

source_address.description: The IP address as seen by the registering server.

type.description: The server type (such as Zone Server or Hub).

server_throttle.description: A server throttle controls the rate at which data is sent across all client connections. For example, use a server throttle to enforce "The server should never use more than 1 Mbps sending sensors to clients". Only one server_throttle object is active at any time. If multiple server_throttle objects exist, the server uses the server_throttle with the lowest ID (closest to 0).

bandwidth_bytes_limit.description: (Optional) The bandwidth limit in bytes. A value of <samp>0</samp> indicates no limit.

connection_limit.description: (Optional) The maximum number of connections to the server. The server rejects connections beyond this limit.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the server_throttle is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the server_throttle is active.

download_bandwidth_bytes_limit.description: (Optional) The download bandwidth limit in bytes. A value of <samp>0</samp> indicates no limit.

download_connection_limit.description: (Optional) The maximum number of download connections to the server. The server rejects connections beyond this limit.

id.description: If you specify a value for the ip_address property, the object is inactive.

ip_address.description: (Optional) The IP address to throttle traffic from.

name.description: (Optional) The name of the server throttle.

sensor_bandwidth_bytes_limit.description: (Optional) The sensor bandwidth limit in bytes. A value of <samp>0</samp> indicates no limit.

sensor_connection_limit.description: (Optional) The maximum number of sensor connections to the server. The server rejects connections beyond this limit.

server_trust.description: A trust relationship between the current server and other Tanium Servers in an active-active cluster.

current_server_trust_id.description: The unique ID of the server_trust object.

current_server_trusts_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the current server trusts the target server, <samp>false</samp> otherwise.

decommissioned_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the current server does not trust the target server anymore, <samp>false</samp> otherwise.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the server_trust object was last modified.

pki_root_keys.description: An array of pki_root_key objects that are associated with the server trust.

reverse_server_trusts_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the target server trusts the current server, <samp>false</samp> otherwise.

server_address.description: The IP address of the target server.

server_creation_date.description: The date and time when the target server first reported.

server_guid.description: The GUID of the target server.

server_name.description: The name of the target server.

site_throttle.description: A site throttle controls the rate at which data is sent to a list of subnets. For example, use a site throttle to enforce "The server should never send more than 5 Mbps to 192.168.0.0/16".

all_subnets_flag.description: (Optional) Value is <samp>1</samp> if the throttle applies to all subnets, value is <samp>0</samp> if only subnets specified in the subnets list are throttled.

bandwidth_bytes_limit.description: (Optional) The bandwidth limit, in bytes. A value of <samp>0</samp> indicates no limit.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the site_throttle is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the site_throttle is active.

download_bandwidth_bytes_limit.description: (Optional) The download bandwidth limit in bytes. A value of <samp>0</samp> indicates no limit.

id.description: The unique ID of the site_throttle object.

name.description: (Optional) The name of the site_throttle object.

sensor_bandwidth_bytes_limit.description: (Optional) The sensor bandwidth limit in bytes. A value of <samp>0</samp> indicates no limit.

subnets.description: (Optional) An array of site_throttle_subnet objects that defines the subnets to throttle.

server_throttle_status.description: The current delays for a server throttle.

id.description: The unique ID of the server_throttle_status object.

name.description: (Optional) The name of the server_throttle_status object.

site_throttle_status.description: The status of the subnets affected by a site throttle.

id.description: The unique ID of the site_throttle_status object.

name.description: The name of the site_throttle_status object.

subnets.description: An array of site_throttle_subnet_status objects that define the subnets and corresponding delays.

site_throttle_subnet.description: A subnet used by a site throttle.

range.description: (Optional) The range of the subnet. For example, <samp>192.160.10.0/16</samp>.

site_throttle_subnet_status.description: The status of a site throttle for a subnet.

download_queue_delay_milliseconds.description: The download queue delay of the subnet, in milliseconds.

queue_delay_milliseconds.description: The queue delay of the subnet, in milliseconds.

sensor_queue_delay_milliseconds.description: The sensor queue delay of the subnet, in milliseconds.

solution.description: Information for a Tanium solution module.

category.description: (Optional) The category to which the solution is assigned.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the solution is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the solution is active.

description.description: (Optional) A description of the solution. This description appears in the user interface.

id.description: The unique ID of the solution object.

imported_by.description: The user who imported the solution.

last_update.description: The date and time when the object was most recently updated.

name.description: (Optional) The name of the solution. This name appears in the user interface.

example.description: Get a complete view of your enterprise inventory by aggregating live asset data with recent data from offline assets.
example.name: Tanium Asset

start_date_restriction.description: An object with restrictions on date, date time, or date time range parameters start values.

interval.description: Set to 1 for seconds, 60 for minutes, 3600 for hours, or 86400 for days.Required if the type property is 1 or 2.

intervalCount.description: The amount of units of time defined in the interval property. Required if the type property is <samp>1</samp> or <samp>2</samp>.

model.description: Set to <samp>com.tanium.models::PointInTime</samp> for a start date restriction.

parameterType.description: Set to <samp>com.tanium.models::PointInTime</samp> for a start date restriction.

type.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> for a date in the future, relative to when the user is prompted, <samp>2</samp> for a date in the past, relative to when the user is prompted, or <samp>3</samp> for a specific date.

unix_time_stamp.description: The date restriction as a Unix timestamp. Required if the type property is <samp>3</samp>.

start_time_restriction.description: An object with restrictions on date time or time parameters start values.

interval.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> for seconds, <samp>60</samp> for minutes, <samp>3600</samp> for hours, or <samp>86400</samp> for days. Required if the type property is <samp>1</samp> or <samp>2</samp>.

intervalCount.description: The amount of units of time defined in <samp>interval</samp>. Required if the type property is <samp>1</samp> or <samp>2</samp>.

model.description: Set to <samp>com.tanium.models::PointInTime</samp> for a start time restriction.

parameterType.description: Set to <samp>com.tanium.models::PointInTime</samp> for a start time restriction.

type.description: Set to <samp>1</samp> for a time in the future, relative to when the user is prompted, <samp>2</samp> for a time in the past, relative to when the user is prompted, or <samp>3</samp> for a specific time.

unix_time_stamp.description: The time restriction as a Unix timestamp. Required if the type property is <samp>3</samp>.

system_setting.description: A system setting, also called a global setting, can affect Tanium Client, Tanium Server, and Tanium Console behavior. This object is returned by the <samp>GET /api/v2/system_settings/{id}</samp> and <samp>GET /api/v2/system_settings/by-name/{name}</samp> paths.

audit_data.description: Audit information for the system setting.

cache_row_id.description: (Optional) The unique ID in the response cache.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the system_setting object.

created_time.description: The UTC time and date when the system_setting object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created the system_setting object.

default_value.description: (Optional) The default value of the system setting. The type depends on the value_type property.

hidden_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>false</samp> for end users to see this system setting.

id.description: The unique ID of the system_setting object.

metadata.description: An array of metadata_item objects that describe this object.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the system_setting object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the system_setting object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the system_setting object.

name.description: (Optional) The name of the system setting. This name appears in the user interface.

read_only_flag.description: (Optional) Value is <samp>false</samp> if the system setting can be modified, value is <samp>true</samp> if the system setting is read-only.

setting_type.description: The type of the system setting.

value.description: (Optional) The current value of the system setting. The type depends on the value_type property. If value_type is <samp>Numeric</samp>, this property cannot exceed <samp>10^19</samp>.

system_status_list.description: System status information. This object is returned by the <samp>GET /api/v2/system_status</samp> path.

client_status.description: Contains details for clients at the last time the clients reported.

upload_file.description: Contains the details of an uploaded file part.

bytes.description: (Optional) The Base64-encoded bytes for the entire file or part of the file.

destination_file.description: (Optional) Specify a name in this property if this file is not intended for the download cache.

file_cached.description: (Optional) Value is <samp>true</samp> if the file is complete and has been moved to the download cache.

file_size.description: (Optional) The size of the complete, unencoded file.

force_overwrite.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>true</samp> to overwrite an existing file with this upload.

hash.description: (Optional) The expected SHA-256 or SHA-512. If empty, the hash is not verified. When the upload completes, this property is populated with the resulting hash of the file.

id.description: When an upload starts, this property is populated with the ID. Use for subsequent upload chunks.

key.description: (Optional) Associate a unique identifier with a file upload. This is returned with each response.

part_size.description: (Optional) The size of the part. You do not need to supply this property as input.

percent_complete.description: The completion percentage of the upload.

start_pos.description: (Optional) The position in the file where this chunk of bytes starts. Use unencoded sizes to calculate the value.

upload_file_status.description: The status of a file upload.

file_cached.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the upload is complete and the file has been moved to the download cache.

file_parts.description: Returns the details of each uploaded upload_file part.

hash.description: The expected SHA-256 of the completed file.

user.description: Use this object to associate user groups, computer groups, and roles with a user.

active_session_count.description: The number of active sessions for this user.

as_persona.description: The ID of the persona currently used by the user. This property is returned by paths with the include_user_details option set to <samp>1</samp>, and only when a persona is active.

content_set_roles.description: (Optional) An array of content_set_role objects assigned to the user.

creation_time.description: The date and time when the user object was created.

deleted_flag.description: (Optional) Value is <samp>true</samp> if the user is deleted, <samp>false</samp> if the user is active.

display_name.description: (Optional) The name of the user that appears in the user interface.

domain.description: (Optional) The domain of the user, if any.

effective_content_set_privileges.description: An array of effective_content_set_privilege objects for the current user, from include_user_details only.

effective_group_id.description: The effective management rights group ID of the user.

group_id.description: (Optional) The management rights group ID for the user.

id.description: The unique ID of the user object.

last_login.description: The date and time of the most recent sign-on by the user for the currently active session.

locked_out.description:
(Optional) Whether a user is locked out. Set to 1 to manually lock out a user. Values include:
  • 0 if the user is not locked out
  • 1 if the user is disabled due to LDAP sync and locked out
  • 2 if the user is missing due to LDAP sync and locked out
  • 3 if the user is locked out for an unknown reason

metadata.description: (Optional) An array of metadata_item objects that describe this object.

modification_time.description: The most recent date and time when this object was modified.

mod_persona.description: The persona who most recently modified this object, if any. This property does not appear when the default persona is used to modify the object.

mod_user.description: The user who most recently modified this object.

name.description: The unique name of the user.

owned_object_ids.description: Administrator only. The content IDs that this user owns. Use with <samp>include_user_owned_object_ids_flag</samp> option.

permissions.description: An array of strings that contain the enabled permissions derived from the user roles and content_set_user_groups.

personas.description: (Optional) An array of persona objects assigned to the user. Use the <samp>POST /api/v2/personas</samp> path to create a persona and assign it to users and user groups.

previous_login.description: The date and time of the user sign-on for the session prior to the currently active session.

roles.description: (Optional) An array of reserved user_role objects assigned to the user.

track_computer_id_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>1</samp> to enable the saved question that tracks the computer ID for the effective group of the user. If the group rights for the user change, the server recreates or updates the tracking saved question accordingly.

track_computer_id_interval.description: (Optional) Use when track_computer_id_flag is <samp>1</samp>. Default is 4 hours; minimum is 1 hour. Values are in seconds. Named groups only.

user_no_recursive_links.description: Use this object to associate user groups, computer groups, and roles with a user.

active_session_count.description: The number of active sessions for this user.

as_persona.description: The ID of the persona currently used by the user. This property is returned by paths with the include_user_details option set to <samp>1</samp>, and only when a persona is active.

content_set_roles.description: (Optional) An array of content_set_role objects assigned to the user.

creation_time.description: The date and time when the user object was created.

deleted_flag.description: (Optional) Value is <samp>true</samp> if the user is deleted, <samp>false</samp> if the user is active.

display_name.description: (Optional) The name of the user that appears in the user interface.

domain.description: (Optional) The domain of the user, if any.

effective_content_set_privileges.description: An array of effective_content_set_privilege objects for the current user, from include_user_details only.

effective_group_id.description: The effective management rights group ID of the user.

group_id.description: (Optional) The management rights group ID for the user.

id.description: The unique ID of the user object.

last_login.description: The date and time of the most recent sign-on by the user for the currently active session.

locked_out.description:
(Optional) Whether a user is locked out. Set to 1 to manually lock out a user. Values include:
  • 0 if the user is not locked out
  • 1 if the user is disabled due to LDAP sync and locked out
  • 2 if the user is missing due to LDAP sync and locked out
  • 3 if the user is locked out for an unknown reason

metadata.description: (Optional) An array of metadata_item objects that describe this object.

modification_time.description: The most recent date and time when this object was modified.

mod_persona.description: The persona who most recently modified this object, if any. This property does not appear when the default persona is used to modify the object.

mod_user.description: The user who most recently modified this object.

name.description: The unique name of the user.

owned_object_ids.description: Administrator only. The content IDs that this user owns. Use with <samp>include_user_owned_object_ids_flag</samp> option.

permissions.description: An array of strings that contain the enabled permissions derived from the user roles and content_set_user_groups.

personas.description: (Optional) An array of persona objects assigned to the user. Use the <samp>POST /api/v2/personas</samp> path to create a persona and assign it to users and user groups.

previous_login.description: The date and time of the user sign-on for the session prior to the currently active session.

roles.description: (Optional) An array of reserved user_role objects assigned to the user.

track_computer_id_flag.description: (Optional) Set to <samp>1</samp> to enable the saved question that tracks the computer ID for the effective group of the user. If the group rights for the user change, the server recreates or updates the tracking saved question accordingly.

track_computer_id_interval.description: (Optional) Use when track_computer_id_flag is <samp>1</samp>. Default is 4 hours; minimum is 1 hour. Values are in seconds. Named groups only.

user_group.description:
Use this object to associate users, computer groups, and roles with a single user group.

Note: You can also assign a persona to a user group. For more information, see the POST /api/v2/personas path.

content_set_roles.description: (Optional) An array of content_set_role objects assigned to the user group. Use to replace the content_set_user_group_role_membership objects for this user_group.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the user_group object.

created_time.description: The UTC time and date when the user_group object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created this object.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the user_group is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the user_group is active.

group.description: (Optional) A computer group to associate with the users and roles.

id.description: The unique ID of the user_group object.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the user_group object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the user_group object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the user_group object.

name.description: (Optional) The unique name of the user group.

user_list.description: (Optional) An array of user objects assigned to the user group.

user_group_no_recursive_links.description:
Use this object to associate users, computer groups, and roles with a single user group.

Note: You can also assign a persona to a user group. For more information, see the POST /api/v2/personas path.

content_set_roles.description: (Optional) An array of content_set_role objects assigned to the user group. Use to replace the content_set_user_group_role_membership objects for this user_group.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the user_group object.

created_time.description: The UTC time and date when the user_group object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created this object.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the user_group is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the user_group is active.

group.description: (Optional) A computer group to associate with the users and roles.

id.description: The unique ID of the user_group object.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the user_group object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the user_group object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the user_group object.

name.description: (Optional) The unique name of the user group.

user_list.description: (Optional) An array of user objects assigned to the user group.

user_owned_object_ids.description:
Arrays of plugin_schedule, saved_action, and saved_question objects that are owned by a user. The following properties are returned for each object:
  • id: The ID of the object
  • name: The name of the object
  • persona_id: - The ID of the persona that was used to create the object. A value of 0 indicates no persona (default persona) was used.

id.description: The unique ID of the user_role object.

name.description: (Optional) The name of the role.

permissions.description: (Optional) An array of strings that contains the permissions assigned to the role.

validationExpressions.description: An array with parameters regular expression validation. Regular expression validations are used by text input, text area, and list parameters. The value a user submits in Tanium Console is checked against all regular expression validations for the parameter. Only if the value matches every regular expression validation for the parameter will the system allow the user to submit the value.

expression.description: (Optional) A JavaScript regular expression applied against the parameter value.

helpString.description: (Optional) Text that appears in Tanium Console to provide the user help to match the regular expression.

model.description: Set to <samp>com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression</samp> for a regular expression validation.

parameterType.description: Set to <samp>com.tanium.models::ValidationExpression</samp> for a regular expression validation.

verify_signature.description: In a request, a Base64-encoded file signature to verify that the file is provided by Tanium. In a response, whether the file signature is verified as provided by Tanium.

bytes.description: The Base64-encoded bytes for the entire file.

id.description: The ID of the bytes property to verify.

type.description:
The type of data to verify. Possible values include:
  • console: for platform-specific plugins
  • content: for console-specific and module-specific archive files
  • manifest: for solution manifest XML files

verified.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the signature was verified, or <samp>false</samp> if the signature was not verified. If a file signature is not verified, do NOT deploy it to the Tanium Server. Contact Tanium for assistance.

version_aggregate.description: The number of machines using a version of the Tanium client.

filtered.description: The number of machines matching a filter, if any. If there is no filter, this value is the same as count.

version_string.description: The version of the Tanium client.

white_listed_url.description: A dynamic URL to permit communication with the Tanium server.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>1</samp> if the white_listed_url is deleted, <samp>0</samp> if the white_listed_url is active.

download_seconds.description: (Optional) The frequency to check the source to see if there is a new version of the file.

expire_seconds.description: (Optional) How long after a client requests this download that it can be cleaned up until requested again. A value of <samp>0</samp> indicates no expiration.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

metadata.description: An array of metadata_item objects that describe this object.

url_regex.description: (Optional) A regular expression containing the URL to add to the whitelist.

xml_error.description: An error returned by the server.

error_context.description: The xml generated at the time of the failure.

exception.description: The exception or failure that occurred.

type.description: The type of object that generated the error.

address.description: The IP address and port of the zone server.

created_persona.description: The persona that was used by the created_user to create the zone_server object.

created_time.description: The date and time when the zone_server object was created.

created_user.description: The user who created the zone_server object.

deleted_flag.description: Value is <samp>true</samp> if the zone_server is deleted, <samp>false</samp> if the zone_server is active.

hub_registration_id.description: The ID of the server_registration_request object corresponding to the hub.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

modified_persona.description: The persona that was used by the modified_user to update the zone_server object.

modified_time.description: The date and time when the zone_server object was last modified.

modified_user.description: The user who last modified the zone_server object.

session.name: session
session.description: The Tanium session string or the token string. The session string is returned by the <samp>POST /api/v2/session/login/</samp> and <samp>POST /api/v2/session/validate</samp> paths. The token string is returned by the <samp>POST /api/v2/api_tokens</samp> path. For examples of both session strings and token strings, see the example requests in the <samp>POST /api/v2/api_tokens</samp> path.
